failto.help: Address to which mailing systems should send delivery failure notifications. Sets the mail envelope reverse-path value.
failto.name: failto

username.help: A user name to send to SMTP servers that require authentication. Requires a password attribute
username.name: username

password.help: A password to send to SMTP servers that require authentication. Requires a username attribute.
password.name: password

wraptext.help: Specifies the maximum line length, in characters of the mail text. If a line has more than the specified number of characters, replaces the last white space character, such as a tab or space, preceding the specified position with a line break. If there are no white space characters, inserts a line break at the specified position. A common value for this attribute is 72.
wraptext.name: wraptext

charset.help: The character encoding in which the part text is encoded.  For more information on character encodings, see: www.w3.org/International/O-charset.html.
charset.name: charset

type.help: The MIME media type of the part. Can be a can be valid MIME media type
type.name: type

mimeattach.help: Path of file to attach to message. Attached file is MIME-encoded. CFML attempts to determine the MIME type of the file; use the cfmailparam tag to send an attachement and specify the MIME type.
mimeattach.name: mimeattach

query.help: Name of cfquery from which to draw data for message(s). Use this attribute to send more than one message, or to send query results within a message.
query.name: query

group.help: Query column to use when you group sets of records to send as a message. For example, to send a set of billing statements to a customer, group on "Customer_ID." Case-sensitive. Eliminates adjacent duplicates when data is sorted by the specified field.
group.name: group

groupcasesensitive.help: Whether to consider case when using the group attribute. To group on case-sensitive records, set this attribute to Yes.
groupcasesensitive.name: groupcasesensitive

startrow.help: Row in a query to start from.
startrow.name: startrow

maxrows.help: Maximum number of messages to send when looping over a query.
maxrows.name: maxrows

server.help: SMTP server address, or (Enterprise edition only) a comma-delimited list of server addresses, to use for sending messages. At least one server must be specified here or in the CFML MX Administrator. A value here overrides the Administrator. A value that includes a port specification overrides the port attribute. See the Usage section for details.
server.name: server

port.help: TCP/IP port on which SMTP server listens for requests (normally 25). A value here overrides the Administrator.
port.name: port

mailerid.help: Mailer ID to be passed in X-Mailer SMTP header, which identifies the mailer application.
mailerid.name: mailerid

timeout.help: Number of seconds to wait before timing out connection to SMTP server. A value here overrides the Administrator.
timeout.name: timeout

spoolenable.help: Specifies whether to spool mail or always send it Immediately. Overrides the CFML MX Administrator Spool mail messages to disk for delivery setting.
spoolenable.name: spoolenable

debug.help: * Yes: sends debugging output to standard output. By default, if the console window is unavailable, ColdFusion sends output to cf_root\runtime\logs\coldfusion-out.log on server configurations. On J2EE configurations, with JRun, the default location is jrun_home/logs/servername-out.log. * No: does not generate debugging output.
debug.name: debug

priority.help: The message priority level. Can be one of the following values: * An integer in the range 1-5; 1 represents the highest priority. * One of the following string values, which correspond to the numeric values: highest or urgent, high, normal, low, and lowest or non-urgent.
priority.name: priority

usessl.help: Whether to use Secure Sockets Layer.
usessl.name: usessl

usetls.help: Whether to use Transport Level Security.
usetls.name: usetls

remove.help: Tells ColdFusion to remove any attachments after successful mail delivery.
remove.name: remove

keystore.help: Keystore containing the private key and certificate. The supported type is JKS (java key store) and pkcs12
keystore.name: keystore

keypassword.help: Password with which the private key is stored. If it is not specified, keystorepassword will be used as keypassword as well.
keypassword.name: keypassword

sign.help: Mail will be signed when set to true
sign.name: sign

keyalias.help: Alias of the key with which the certificate and private key is stored in keystore. If it is not specified then the first entry in the keystore will be picked up.
keyalias.name: keyalias

encrypt.help: If email should be encrypted or not.
encrypt.name: encrypt

recipientCert.help: Path to public key certificate of recipient.
recipientCert.name: recipientCert

cfmail (to).help: Sends an e-mail message that optionally contains query output, using an SMTP server.
cfmail (to).name: cfmail

cc.help: Address(es) to which to copy the message
cc.name: cc

bcc.help: Address(es) to which to copy the message, without listing them in the message header.
bcc.name: bcc

subject.help: Message subject. Can be dynamically generated.
subject.name: subject

replyto.help: Address(es) to which the recipient is directed to send replies.
replyto.name: replyto

failto.help: Address to which mailing systems should send delivery failure notifications. Sets the mail envelope reverse-path value.
failto.name: failto

password.help: A password to send to SMTP servers that require authentication. Requires a username attribute.
password.name: password

query.name: query

group.name: group

groupcasesensitive.help: Whether to consider case when using the group attribute. To group on case-sensitive records, set this attribute to Yes.
groupcasesensitive.name: groupcasesensitive

startrow.name: startrow

maxrows.help: Maximum number of messages to send when looping over a query.
maxrows.name: maxrows

mailerid.name: mailerid

timeout.help: Number of seconds to wait before timing out connection to SMTP server. A value here overrides the Administrator.
timeout.name: timeout

spoolenable.help: Specifies whether to spool mail or always send it Immediately. Overrides the CFML MX Administrator Spool mail messages to disk for delivery setting.
spoolenable.name: spoolenable

priority.name: priority

usessl.help: Whether to use Secure Sockets Layer.
usessl.name: usessl

usetls.help: Whether to use Transport Level Security.
usetls.name: usetls

remove.name: remove

keystore.name: keystore

keypassword.help: Password with which the private key is stored. If it is not specified, keystorepassword will be used as keypassword as well.

sign.name: sign

keyalias.help: Alias of the key with which the certificate and private key is stored in keystore. If it is not specified then the first entry in the keystore will be picked up.
keyalias.name: keyalias

encrypt.help: If email should be encrypted or not.
encrypt.name: encrypt

recipientCert.help: Path to public key certificate of recipient.
recipientCert.name: recipientCert

cfmail.help: Sends an e-mail message that optionally contains query output, using an SMTP server.
cfmail.name: cfmail

file.help: Attaches file to a message. Mutually exclusive with name attribute. The file is MIME encoded before sending.
file.name: file

type.help: The MIME media type of the part. Can be a can be valid MIME media type
type.name: type

name.help: Name of header. Case-insensitive. Mutually exclusive with file attribute. The values listed are from rfc2822
name.name: name

value.help: Value of the header.
value.name: value

contentID.help: The Identifier for the attached file. This ID should be globally unique and is used to identify the file in an IMG or other tag in the mail body that references the file content.
contentID.name: contentID

disposition.help: How the attached file is to be handled. Can be one of the following: - attachment: present the file as an attachment - inline: display the file contents in the message
disposition.name: disposition

content.help: Lets you send the contents of a ColdFusion variable as an attachment
content.name: content

remove.help: Tells ColdFusion to remove any attachments after successful mail delivery.
remove.name: remove

cfmailparam.help: Attaches a file or adds a header to an e-mail message. Can only be used in the cfmail tag. You can use more than one cfmailparam tag within a cfmail tag.
cfmailparam.name: cfmailparam

type.help: The MIME media type of the part. Can be a can be valid MIME media type
type.name: type

wraptext.help: Specifies the maximum line length, in characters of the mail text. If a line has more than the specified number of characters, replaces the last white space character, such as a tab or space, preceding the specified position with a line break. If there are no white space characters, inserts a line break at the specified position. A common value for this attribute is 72.
wraptext.name: wraptext

charset.help: The character encoding in which the part text is encoded.  For more information on character encodings, see: www.w3.org/International/O-charset.html.
charset.name: charset

cfmailpart.help: Specifies one part of a multipart e-mail message. Can only be used in the cfmail tag. You can use more than one cfmailpart tag within a cfmail tag.
cfmailpart.name: cfmailpart

template.help: Mutually exclusive with the name attribute. A path to the page that implements the tag.  Relative path: expanded from the current page Absolute path: expanded using CFML mapping A physical path is not valid.
template.name: template

name.help: Mutually exclusive with the template attribute. A custom tag name, in the form "Name.Name.Name..." Identifies subdirectory, under the CFML tag root directory, that contains custom tag page. For example (Windows format):  <cfmodule name = "superduper.Forums40.GetUserOptions">  This identifies the page GetUserOptions.cfm in the directory CustomTags\superduper\Forums40 under the CFML root directory.
name.name: name

attributecollection.help: A collection of key-value pairs that represent attribute names and values. You can specify multiple key-value pairs. You can specify this attribute only once.
attributecollection.name: attributecollection

cfmodule.help: Invokes a custom tag for use in CFML application pages. This tag processes custom tag name conflicts.
cfmodule.name: cfmodule

username.help: User's login name.
username.name: username

password.help: User's login name.
password.name: password

domain.help: Domain against which to authenticate the user. The ColdFusion J2EE server must be running on this domain.
domain.name: domain

result.help: Name of the variable in which to return the results. Default: cfntauthenticate
result.name: result

listgroups.help: Boolean value specifying whether to Include a comma-delimited list of the user's groups in the result structure. Default: false
listgroups.name: listgroups

throwonerror.help: Boolean value specifying whether to throw an exception if the validation fails. If this attribute is true, ColdFusion throws an error if the user name or password is invalid; the application must handle such errors in a try/catch block or ColdFusion error handler page. Default: false
throwonerror.name: throwonerror

cfntauthenticate (domain).help: Authenticates a user name and password against the NT domain on which ColdFusion server is running, and optionally retrieves the user's groups.
cfntauthenticate (domain).name: cfntauthenticate

type.help: The object type. You can omit this attribute or specify component. ColdFusion automatically sets the type to component.
type.name: type

action.help: *  create: instantiates a COM object (typically, a DLL) before invoking methods or properties. * connect: ionnects to a COM object (typically, an EXE) running on server.
action.name: action

class.help: Component ProgID for the object to invoke. When using Java stubs to connect to the COM object, the class must be the ProgID of the COM object.
class.name: class

context.help: *  inproc * local * remote  In Windows, if not specified, uses Registry setting.
context.name: context

server.help: Server name, using Universal Naming Convention (UNC) or Domain Name Serve (DNS) convention, in one of these forms:  * \\lanserver * lanserver * http://www.servername.com * www.servername.com * 127.0.0.1
server.name: server

locale.help: Sets arguments for a call to init_orb. Use this attribute only for VisiBroker ORBs. It is available on C++, Version 3.2. The value must be in the form: locale = " -ORBagentAddr 199.99.129.33 -ORBagentPort 19000"  Each type-value pair must start with a hyphen.
locale.name: locale

webservice.help: One of the following:  * The absolute URL of the web service. * The name (string) assigned in the ColdFusion Administrator to the web service.
webservice.name: webservice

password.help: The password to use to access the web service. If the webservice attribute specifies a web service name configured in the ColdFusion Administrator, overrides any password specified in the Administrator entry.
password.name: password

secure.help: Whether to secure communications with the .NET-side agent. If true, ColdFusion uses SSL to communicate with .NET.
secure.name: secure

protocol.help: Protocol to use to use for communication between ColdFusion and .NET. Must be one of the following values: * http: Use HTTP/SOAP communication protocol. This option is slower than tcp, but might be required for access through a firewall. * tcp: Use binary TCP/IP protocol. This method is more efficient than HTTP.
protocol.name: protocol

proxyserver.help: The proxy server required to access the web service URL.
proxyserver.name: proxyserver

refreshwsdl.help: *  yes: reloads the WSDL file and regenerates the artifacts used to consume the web service * no
refreshwsdl.name: refreshwsdl

wsportname.help: The port name for the web service. This value is case-sensitive and corresponds to the port element's name attribute under the service element.
wsportname.name: wsportname

wsdl2javaargs.help: A string that contains a space-delimited list of arguments to pass to the WSDL2Java tool that generates Java stubs for the web services.
wsdl2javaargs.name: wsdl2javaargs

proxyport.help: The port to use on the proxy server.
proxyport.name: proxyport

port.help: Port number at which the .NET-side agent is listening.
port.name: port

proxypassword.help: The user's password on the proxy server.
proxypassword.name: proxypassword

assembly.help: For local .NET assemblies, the absolute path or paths to the assembly or assemblies (EXE or DLL files) from which to access the .NET class and its supporting classes. For remote .NET assemblies, you must specify the absolute path or paths of the local proxy JAR file or files that represent the assemblies.
assembly.name: assembly

username.help: The user name to use to access the web service. If the webservice attribute specifies a web service configured name in the ColdFusion Administrator, overrides any user name specified in the Administrator entry.
username.name: username

proxyuser.help: The user ID to send to the proxy server.
proxyuser.name: proxyuser

wsversion.help: Axis version to be used for generating WebSerive stubs
wsversion.name: wsversion

cfobject.help: Creates a CFML object, of a specified type.  The tag syntax depends on the object type. Some types use the type attribute; others do not.
cfobject.name: cfobject

action.help: clear: Clears queries from the cache in the Application scope
action.name: action

query.help: Name of cfquery from which to draw data for output section.
query.name: query

group.help: Query column to use to group sets of records. Eliminates adjacent duplicate rows when data is sorted. Use if you retrieved a record set ordered on one or more a query columns. For example, if a record set is ordered on "Customer_ID" in the cfquery tag, you can group the output on "Customer_ID."
group.name: group

groupcasesensitive.help: Whether to consider the case in grouping rows.
groupcasesensitive.name: groupcasesensitive

startrow.help: Row from which to start output.
startrow.name: startrow

maxrows.help: Maximum number of rows to display.
maxrows.name: maxrows

cfoutput.help: Displays output that can contain the results of processing CFML variables and functions. Can loop over the results of a database query.
cfoutput.name: cfoutput

name.help: Name of parameter to test (such as "client.email" or "cookie.backgroundColor"). If omitted, and if the parameter does not exist, an error is thrown.
name.name: name

help._: The valid format for the data; one of the following.

li: any: any type of value.
array: an array of values.
binary: a binary value.
boolean: a Boolean value: yes, no, true, false, or a number.
creditcard: a 13-16 digit number conforming to the mod10 algorithm.
date or time: a date-time value.
email: a valid e-mail address.
eurodate: a date-time value. Any date part must be in theformat dd/mm/yy, The format can use /, -, or . characters as delimiters.
float or numeric: a numeric value.
guid: a Universally Unique Identifier of the form "XXXXXXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXXXXXXXXXX" where 'X' is a hexadecimal number.
numeric: a numeric value
integer: an integer.
query: a query object.
range: a numeric range, specified by the min and max attributes.
regex or regular_expression: matches input against pattern attribute.
ssn or social_security_number: a U.S. social security number.
string: a string value or single character.
struct: a structure.
telephone: a standard U.S. telephone number.
URL: an http, https, ftp, file, mailto, or news URL.
UUID: a ColdFusion Universally Unique Identifier, formatted 'XXXXXXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXXXXXXXXXXXXX', where 'X' is a hexadecimal number. See CreateUUID.
USdate: a U.S. date of the format mm/dd/yy, with 1-2 digit days and months, 1-4 digit years.
variableName: a string formatted according to ColdFusion variable naming conventions.
xml: XML objects and XML strings.
zipcode: U.S., 5- or 9-digit format ZIP codes.

default.help: Value to set parameter to if it does not exist. Any expression used for the default attribute is evaluated, even if the parameter exists. The result is not assigned if the parameter exists, but if the expression has side effects, they still occur.
default.name: default

max.help: The maximum valid value; used only for range validation.
max.name: max

min.help: The minimum valid value; used only for range validation.
min.name: min

pattern.help: A regular experession that the parameter must match; used only for regex or regular_expression validation.
pattern.name: pattern

maxlength.help: Maximum length of value. Valid for String, email and url types
maxlength.name: maxlength

cfparam (name).help: Tests for a parameter's existence, tests its data type, and, if a default value is not assigned, optionally provides one.
cfparam (name).name: cfparam

name.help: Name of parameter to test (such as "client.email" or "cookie.backgroundColor"). If omitted, and if the parameter does not exist, an error is thrown.
name.name: name

li: any: any type of value.
array: an array of values.
binary: a binary value.
boolean: a Boolean value: yes, no, true, false, or a number.

date or time: a date-time value.
email: a valid e-mail address.

float or numeric: a numeric value.

numeric: a numeric value
integer: an integer.
query: a query object.
range: a numeric range, specified by the min and max attributes.
regex or regular_expression: matches input against pattern attribute.
ssn or social_security_number: a U.S. social security number.
string: a string value or single character.
struct: a structure.
telephone: a standard U.S. telephone number.
URL: an http, https, ftp, file, mailto, or news URL.

zipcode: U.S., 5- or 9-digit format ZIP codes.

default.help: Value to set parameter to if it does not exist. Any expression used for the default attribute is evaluated, even if the parameter exists. The result is not assigned if the parameter exists, but if the expression has side effects, they still occur.
default.name: default

max.help: The maximum valid value; used only for range validation.
max.name: max

min.help: The minimum valid value; used only for range validation.
min.name: min

pattern.help: A regular experession that the parameter must match; used only for regex or regular_expression validation.
pattern.name: pattern

maxlength.help: Maximum length of value. Valid for String, email and url types
maxlength.name: maxlength

cfparam.help: Tests for a parameter's existence, tests its data type, and, if a default value is not assigned, optionally provides one.
cfparam.name: cfparam

bodyStyle.help: A CSS style specification for the pod body. As a general rule, use this attribute to set color and font styles. Using this attribute to set the height and width, for example, can result in distorted output.
bodyStyle.name: bodyStyle

headerStyle.help: A CSS style specification for the pod header. As a general rule, use this attribute to set color and font styles. Using this attribute to set the height and width, for example, can result in distorted output.
headerStyle.name: headerStyle

height.help: Height if the control, including the title bar and borders, in pixels.  Default is 100.
height.name: height

onBindError.help: The name of a JavaScript function to execute if evaluating a bind expression results in an error. The function must take two attributes: an HTTP status code and a message. If you omit this attribute, and have specified a global error handler (by using the ColdFusion.setGlobalErrorHandler function), it displays the error message; otherwise a default error pop-up displays.
onBindError.name: onBindError

overflow.help: Specifies how to display child content whose size would cause the control to overflow the pod boundaries.  Note: In Internet Explorer, pods with the visible setting expand to fit the size of the contents, rather than having the contents extend beyond the layout area.
overflow.name: overflow

source.help: A URL that returns the pod contents. ColdFusion uses standard page path resolution rules. If you specify this attribute and the cfpod tag has a body, ColdFusion ignores the body contents. You can use a a bind expression with dependencies in this attribute; for more information see the Usage section. Note: If a CFML page specified in this attribute contains tags that use AJAX features, such as cfform, cfgrid, and cfwindow, you must use a cfajaximport tag on the page with the cfpod tag. For more information, see cfajaximport.
source.name: source

title.help: Text to display in the pod?s title bar. You can use HTML mark up to control the title appearance, of example to show the text in red italic font. If you omit this attribute, the pod does not have a title bar.
title.name: title

width.help: Width if the control, including the title bar and borders, in pixels. Default is 500.
width.name: width

cfpod.help: Creates a pod, an area of the browser window or layout area with an optional title bar and body that contains display elements.
cfpod.name: cfpod

server.help: POP server identifier: A host name; for example, "biff.upperlip.com" An IP address; for example, "192.1.2.225"
server.name: server

username.help: Overrides username.
username.name: username

password.help: Overrides password
password.name: password

action.help: getHeaderOnly: returns message header information only getAll: returns message header information, message text, and attachments if attachmentPath is specified delete: deletes messages on POP server
action.name: action

name.help: Name for query object that contains the retrieved message information.
name.name: name

messagenumber.help: Message number or comma-delimited list of message numbers to get or delete. Invalid message numbers are ignored. Ignored if uid is specified.
messagenumber.name: messagenumber

uid.help: UID or a comma-delimited list of UIDs to get or delete. Invalid UIDs are ignored.
uid.name: uid

attachmentpath.help: If action="getAll", specifies a directory in which to save any attachments. If the directory does not exist, CFML creates it.  If you omit this attribute, CFML does not save any attachments. If you specify a relative path, the path root is the CFML temporary directory, which is returned by the GetTempDirectory function.
attachmentpath.name: attachmentpath

timeout.help: Maximum time, in seconds, to wait for mail processing
timeout.name: timeout

maxrows.help: Number of messages to return or delete, starting with the number in startRow. Ignored if messageNumber or uid is specified.
maxrows.name: maxrows

startrow.help: First row number to get or delete. Ignored if messageNumber or uid is specified.
startrow.name: startrow

generateUniqueFileNames.help: Yes: Generate unique filenames for files attached to an e-mail message, to avoid naming conflicts when files are saved
generateUniqueFileNames.name: generateUniqueFileNames

cfpop.help: Retrieves or deletes e-mail messages from a POP mail server.
cfpop.name: cfpop

suppressWhitespace.help: Boolean; whether to suppress white space characters within the cfprocessingdirective block that are generated by CFML tags and often do not affect HTML appearance. Does not affect any white space in HTML code.
suppressWhitespace.name: suppressWhitespace

pageEncoding.help: A string literal; cannot be a variable. Identifies the character encoding of the current CFML page. This attribute affects the entire page, not just the cfprocessing tag body. The value may be enclosed in single or double quotation marks, or none.  For more information on character encodings, see: www.w3.org/International/O-charset.html.
pageEncoding.name: pageEncoding

cfprocessingdirective.help: Provides the following insformation to CFML on how to process the current page:  * Specifies whether to remove excess whitespace character from CFML generated content in the tag body. * Identifies the character encoding (character set) of the page contents.
cfprocessingdirective.name: cfprocessingdirective

type.help: in: The parameter is used to send data to the database system only. Passes the parameter by value. out: The parameter is used to receive data from the database system only. Passes the parameter as a bound variable. inout: The parameter is used to send and receive data. Passes the parameter as a bound variable.
type.name: type

variable.help: CFML variable name; references the value that the output parameter has after the stored procedure is called.
variable.name: variable

value.help: Value that CFML passes to the stored procedure.
value.name: value

cfsqltype.help: SQL type to which the parameter (any type) is bound. CFML supports the following values, where the last element of the name corresponds to the SQL data type. Different database systems might support different subsets of this list. See your DBMS documentation for information on supported parameter types.
cfsqltype.name: cfsqltype

maxlength.help: Maximum length of a string or character IN or INOUT value attribute. A maxLength of 0 allows any length. The maxLength attribute is not required when specifying type=out.
maxlength.name: maxlength

scale.help: Number of decimal places in numeric parameter. A scale of 0 allows any number of decimal places.
scale.name: scale

null.help: Whether the parameter is passed in as a null value. Not used with OUT type parameters.
null.name: null

cfprocparam (cfsqltype).help: Defines stored procedure parameters. This tag is nested within a cfstoredproc tag.
cfprocparam (cfsqltype).name: cfprocparam

type.help: in: The parameter is used to send data to the database system only. Passes the parameter by value. out: The parameter is used to receive data from the database system only. Passes the parameter as a bound variable. inout: The parameter is used to send and receive data. Passes the parameter as a bound variable.
type.name: type

variable.help: CFML variable name; references the value that the output parameter has after the stored procedure is called.
variable.name: variable

value.help: Value that CFML passes to the stored procedure.
value.name: value

cfsqltype.help: SQL type to which the parameter (any type) is bound. CFML supports the following values, where the last element of the name corresponds to the SQL data type. Different database systems might support different subsets of this list. See your DBMS documentation for information on supported parameter types.
cfsqltype.name: cfsqltype

maxlength.help: Maximum length of a string or character IN or INOUT value attribute. A maxLength of 0 allows any length. The maxLength attribute is not required when specifying type=out.
maxlength.name: maxlength

scale.help: Number of decimal places in numeric parameter. A scale of 0 allows any number of decimal places.
scale.name: scale

null.help: Whether the parameter is passed in as a null value. Not used with OUT type parameters.
null.name: null

cfprocparam.help: Defines stored procedure parameters. This tag is nested within a cfstoredproc tag.
cfprocparam.name: cfprocparam

name.help: Name for the query result set.
name.name: name

resultset.help: Names one result set, if stored procedure returns more than one.
resultset.name: resultset

maxrows.help: Maximum number of rows returned in result set.
maxrows.name: maxrows

cfprocresult (name).help: Associates a query object with a result set returned by a stored procedure. Other CFML tags, such as cfoutput and cftable, use this query object to access the result set. This tag is nested within a cfstoredproc tag.
cfprocresult (name).name: cfprocresult

name.help: Name for the query result set.
name.name: name

resultset.help: Names one result set, if stored procedure returns more than one.
resultset.name: resultset

maxrows.help: Maximum number of rows returned in result set.
maxrows.name: maxrows

cfprocresult.help: Associates a query object with a result set returned by a stored procedure. Other CFML tags, such as cfoutput and cftable, use this query object to access the result set. This tag is nested within a cfstoredproc tag.
cfprocresult.name: cfprocresult

name.help: Specifies the name of the property.
name.name: name

type.help: Specifies the ColdFusion data type for the property.
type.name: type

default.help: This sets the default value on the property when the object is created.
default.name: default

displayname.help: A value to be displayed when using introspection to show information about the CFC. The value appears in parentheses following the property name.
displayname.name: displayname

hint.help: Text to be displayed when using introspection to show information about the CFC. This attribute can be useful for describing the purpose of the parameter.
hint.name: hint

fieldtype.help: This attribute is used to specify the type of the property. Use this attribute to specify the following: * Primary key: Specify fieldtype = "id" to map a property to the primary key in the table. * Column: Specify the fieldtype = "column" to map a property to a column in the table. * Relationship: Specify the fieldtype = "relationship_type". The relationship_type can be one-to-one, one-to-many, many-to-one, or many-to-many. * Version: Specify the fieldtype="versionâ€ to indicate that the column contains versioned data. * Timestamp: Specify the fieldtype="timestamp" to indicate the column contains data with timestamp. * Collection: Specify the fieldtype="collection" to define the collection mapping.
fieldtype.name: fieldtype

ormType.help: Used to specify the data type of the primary key. If data type is not set and the ORM setting useDBForMapping=true, then the ormtype is determined by inspecting the database.
ormType.name: ormType

column.help: Used to specify the primary key column name.
column.name: column

generator.help: Algorithm used to generate unique identifiers for instances of the persistent CFC.
generator.name: generator

sequence.help: Sequence key name in the database.
sequence.name: sequence

selectkey.help: The column name that is used to retrieve the primary key generated by a database trigger.
selectkey.name: selectkey

params.help: Additional parameters required by the various generators to generate the ID. The value for the params attribute should follow the CF Struct syntax. For example: params = {key1='value1', key2='value2'}
params.name: params

length.help: Use this attribute to specify the length of the column. This attribute is used for table creation only.
length.name: length

index.help: Specifies the name of an index that is created using the mapped column
index.name: index

setter.help: Specifies whether to generate setter methods or not
setter.name: setter

getter.help: Specifies whether to generate getter methods or not
getter.name: getter

source.help: Specifies the source from where the timestamp has to be retrieved
source.name: source

elementcolumn.help: Column name in the table that is used as value in struct.
elementcolumn.name: elementcolumn

structkeytype.help: Specifies the data type of the key, when collectiontype=struct.
structkeytype.name: structkeytype

structkeycolumn.help: The column in the target table to use as key if the collection type is struct.
structkeycolumn.name: structkeycolumn

inversejoincolumn.help: Specifies the foreign key column in the Join table that references the primary key column in the target table.
inversejoincolumn.name: inversejoincolumn

missingRowIgnored.help: If the value is true, and the row that is referenced by the foreign key is missing, it is treated as a null association. The default is false, in which case an exception occurs.
missingRowIgnored.name: missingRowIgnored

inverse.help: A Boolean value that specifies bidirectional association
inverse.name: inverse

fetch.help: Specifies if it is outer-join fetching or sequential select fetching
fetch.name: fetch

cascade.help: Specifies which operations should be cascaded from the parent object to the associated object
cascade.name: cascade

constrained.help: Whether a constraint is set on this table's Primary Key column to reference the Primary Key in the other table
constrained.name: constrained

unique.help: Specifies if there should be a unique constraint on the column.
unique.name: unique

uniquekey.help: Groups columns in a single unique key constraint.
uniquekey.name: uniquekey

notnull.help: A Boolean value that specifies whether a notnull constriant should be added for this column.
notnull.name: notnull

update.help: Whether the column should be included in the SQL update statement. Set update=false and insert=false if the column needs to be read-only.
update.name: update

insert.help: Whether the column should be included in SQL UPDATE and/or INSERT tatements. Set update=false and insert=false if the column needs to be read-only.
insert.name: insert

generated.help: Specifies that this property value is actually generated by the database {never|always|insert} * never: Specifies that the value for this property is never generated by database * always: Specifies that the value for this property is always generated by database * insert: Specifies that the value for this property is generated at the time of insert but is not regenerated at updates.
generated.name: generated

formula.help: SQL expression that defines the value of the property.If you specify a formula, the column value is ignored.
formula.name: formula

lazy.help: Specifies if loading is to be done by parts:
lazy.name: lazy

optimisticLock.help: Whether updates to this property require acquisition of the optimistic lock on the table row
optimisticLock.name: optimisticLock

mappedby.help: Property in the target CFC that is referenced by the foreign key in the Join table.
mappedby.name: mappedby

joinColumn.help: Use this attribute to define the join column for inheritance mapping.
joinColumn.name: joinColumn

validate.help: Takes the validator to be used for validating data when implicit setter for this property is called.
validate.name: validate

validateParams.help: Takes the parameters required by the validator specified in the validate attribute. This should be specified in the implicit struct notation eg. validateparams="{min=18,max=60}">.  min: Minimum value if validate is integer/numeric/ max: Maximum value if the validate is integer/numeric/ minLength: Minimum length of the string if the validate is string minLength: Maximum length of the string if the validate is string pattern: regex expression if the validator specified in validate attribute is regex
validateParams.name: validateParams

sqlType.help: Use this attribute to specify the DB-specific SQLType that should be used for the column. This attribute is used for table creation only. If this attribute is not specified, ColdFusion will automatically decide the SQLType based on the ormtype specified for this property.
sqlType.name: sqlType

dbDefault.help: This sets the default value of a column in the table when schema is exported.
dbDefault.name: dbDefault

persistent.help: Specifies whether this property should be persisted. If persistent="falseâ€ all the ORM related attributes are ignored. Set this attribute to false if you do not want this property to be persisted by ORM.
persistent.name: persistent

unSavedValue.help: An identifier property value that indicates that an instance is newly instantiated and not saved/loaded in the database
unSavedValue.name: unSavedValue

serializable.help: Specifies whether this property can be serialized. If you set this value to false, the property cannot be serialized, so any changes made are not retained on session replication, and the property has its default value (if any) on the second server. Use this attribute to prevent serializaton of properties in CFCs that are serializable.
serializable.name: serializable

singularname.help: Use this prperty to define the custom name for generated relationship methods. Applies to one-to-many and  many-to-many
singularname.name: singularname

remotingFetch.help: If remotingFetch is false, then the value of that attribute is not sent over flash remoting. remotingFetch is true by default was all properties. But in case of cfcs for which persistent = true, the value of the remotingFetch attribute is false by default for any property that shares one-to-one, one-to-many, many-to-one or many-to-many relationship.
remotingFetch.name: remotingFetch

indexBoost.help: Used to prioritize the search results. Higher the boost, more the priority. Default is 1.
indexBoost.name: indexBoost

indexTokenize.help: If true, marks the column for indexing. Except in the case of PK and compositekey (which are indexed if any of the non-PK property is set to indexed), the default value is false
indexTokenize.name: indexTokenize

indexStore.help: true: Stores the value in the original form, without tokenizing. false: Does not store the value. compressed: Stores the original value in a compressed form, based on Lucene implementation
indexStore.name: indexStore

indexFieldName.help: Specifies the field name that is used in search query while indexing and performing search
indexFieldName.name: indexFieldName

indexable.help: If true, marks the column for indexing. Except in the case of PK and compositekey (which are indexed if any of the non-PK property is set to indexed), the default value is false
indexable.name: indexable

indexLanguage.help: Specify the language that is used to index and search. The value overrides the value defined in cfcomponent and the Application.cfc
indexLanguage.name: indexLanguage

cfproperty.help: Defines properties of a CFML component (CFC). Used to create complex data types for web services. The attributes of this tag are exposed as component metadata and are subject to inheritance rules.
cfproperty.name: cfproperty

name.help: Name of query. Used in page to reference query record set. Must begin with a letter. Can include letters, numbers, and underscores.
name.name: name

datasource.help: Name of data source from which query gets data.
datasource.name: datasource

ormoptions.help: A struct that takes orm options for executing HQL. Applies only if dbtype is set to hql.
ormoptions.name: ormoptions

dbtype.help: query. Use this value to specify the results of a query as input.
dbtype.name: dbtype

username.help: Overrides username in data source setup.
username.name: username

password.help: Overrides password in data source setup.
password.name: password

maxrows.help: Maximum number of rows to return in record set. -1 returns all records.
maxrows.name: maxrows

blockfactor.help: Maximum rows to get at a time from server. Range: 1 - 100. Might not be supported by some database systems.
blockfactor.name: blockfactor

timeout.help: Maximum number of seconds that each action of a query is permitted to execute before returning an error. The cumulative time may exceed this value.  For JDBC statements, CFML sets this attribute. For other drivers, check driver documentation.
timeout.name: timeout

cachedafter.help: Date value (for example, April 16, 1999, 4-16-99). If date of original query is after this date, CFML uses cached query data. To use cached data, current query must use same SQL statement, data source, query name, user name, password.  A date/time object is in the range 100 AD-9999 AD.  When specifying a date value as a string, you must enclose it in quotation marks.
cachedafter.name: cachedafter

cachedwithin.help: Timespan, using the CreateTimeSpan function. If original query date falls within the time span, cached query data is used. CreateTimeSpan defines a period from the present, back. Takes effect only if query caching is enabled in the Administrator.  To use cached data, the current query must use the same SQL statement, data source, query name, user name, and password.
cachedwithin.name: cachedwithin

debug.help: Yes: If debugging is enabled, but the Administrator Database Activity option is not enabled, displays SQL submitted to datasource and number of records returned by query. No: If the Administrator Database Activity option is enabled, suppresses display.
debug.name: debug

result.help: Specifies a name for the structure in which cfquery returns the result variables. * SQL: The SQL statement that was executed. (string) * Cached: If the query was cached. (boolean) * SqlParameters: An ordered Array of cfqueryparam values. (array) * RecordCount: Total number of records in the query. (numeric) * ColumnList: Column list, comma seperated. (numeric) * ExecutionTime: Execution time for the SQL request. (numeric)
result.name: result

cacheId.help: Id with which query result should be stored in cache.
cacheId.name: cacheId

cacheRegion.help: Name of cache region in which query result should be stored.
cacheRegion.name: cacheRegion

fetchclientinfo.help: Flag to indicate if clientinfo properties should be added to the result variable
fetchclientinfo.name: fetchclientinfo

clientinfo.help: Contains clientinfo properties to be set on the database connection
clientinfo.name: clientinfo

cfquery.help: Passes queries or SQL statements to a data source. It is recommended that you use the cfqueryparam tag within every cfquery tag, to help secure your databases from unauthorized users
cfquery.name: cfquery

value.help: Value that CFML passes to the right of the comparison operator in a where clause.  If CFSQLType is a date or time option, ensure that the date value uses your DBMS-specific date format. Use the CreateODBCDateTime or DateFormat and TimeFormat functions to format the date value.
value.name: value

cfsqltype.help: SQL type that parameter (any type) is bound to.
cfsqltype.name: cfsqltype

scale.help: Number of decimal places in parameter. Applies to CF_SQL_NUMERIC and CF_SQL_DECIMAL.
scale.name: scale

null.help: Whether parameter is passed as a null value.  Yes: tag ignores the value attribute No: does not
null.name: null

list.help: Yes: The value attribute value is a delimited list No: it is not
list.name: list

separator.help: Character that separates values in list, in value attribute.
separator.name: separator

cfqueryparam.help: Verifies the data type of a query parameter and, for DBMSs that support bind variables, enables CFML to use bind variables in the SQL statement. Bind variable usage enhances performance when executing a cfquery statement multiple times.  This tag is nested within a cfquery tag, embedded in a query SQL statement. If you specify optional parameters, this tag performs data validation.
cfqueryparam.name: cfqueryparam

action.help: Action to perform
action.name: action

entry.help: Registry value to access. Note: For key deletion this attribute is required.
entry.name: entry

variable.help: Variable into which to put value.
variable.name: variable

type.help: * string: returns string values. * dWord: returns DWord values. * key: returns keys. * any: returns keys and values.
type.name: type

sort.help: Sorts query column data (case-insensitive). Sorts on Entry, Type, and Value columns as text. Specify a combination of columns from query output, in a comma-delimited list. For example: sort = "value desc, entry asc" * asc: ascending (a to z) sort order. * desc: descending (z to a) sort order.
sort.name: sort

directory.help: Absolute pathname of directory against which to perform action.
directory.name: directory

mode.help: Applies only to UNIX and Linux. Permissions. Octal values of Unix chmod command. Assigned to owner, group, and other, respectively.
mode.name: mode

value.help: Value data to set. If you omit this attribute, the cfregistry tag creates default value, as follows: * string: creates an empty string: "". * dWord: creates a value of 0 (zero).
value.name: value

recurse.help: Whether ColdFusion performs the action on subdirectories.
recurse.name: recurse

cfregistry.help: Reads, writes, and deletes keys and values in the system registry. Provides persistent storage of client variables. This tag is deprecated for the UNIX platform. Note: For this tag to execute, it must be enabled in the ColdFusion MX Administrator.
cfregistry.name: cfregistry

template.help: Specifies the path to the report definition file, relative to the web root.
template.name: template

name.help: The name of the ColdFusion variable that will hold the report output. You cannot specify both name and filename.
name.name: name

filename.help: The filename to contain the report. You cannot specify both name and filename.
filename.name: filename

query.help: The name of the query that contains input data for the report. If you omit this parameter, the report definition obtains data from the internal SQL or from cfreportparam items.
query.name: query

overwrite.help: Specifies whether to overwrite files that have the same name as that specified in the filename attribute. Default: false
overwrite.name: overwrite

encryption.help: Specifies whether the output is encrypted. PDF format only. Default: none
encryption.name: encryption

ownerpassword.help: Specifies an owner password. PDF format only.
ownerpassword.name: ownerpassword

userpassword.help: Specifies a user password. PDF format only.
userpassword.name: userpassword

permissions.help: Specifies one or more permissions. PDF format only. Separate multiple permissions with a comma.
permissions.name: permissions

datasource.help: Name of registered or native data source.
datasource.name: datasource

type.help: * standard (not valid for Crystal Reports 8.0) * netscape * microsoft
type.name: type

timeout.help: Maximum time, in seconds, in which a connection must be made to a Crystal Report.
timeout.name: timeout

report.help: Report path. Store Crystal Reports files in the same directories as CFML page files.
report.name: report

orderby.help: Orders results according to your specifications.
orderby.name: orderby

username.help: Username required for entry into database from which report is created. Overrides default settings for data source in CFML Administrator.
username.name: username

password.help: Password that corresponds to username required for database access. Overrides default settings for data source in CFML Administrator.
password.name: password

formula.help: One or more named formulas. Terminate each formula with a semicolon. Use the format:  formula = "formulaname1='formula1';formulaname2='formula2';"  If you use a semicolon in a formula, you must escape it by typing it twice (;;). For example:  formula = "Name1 = 'Val_1a;;Val_1b';Name2 = 'Val2';"
formula.name: formula

resourceTimespan.help: Life span of the resource directory. Used only with format=HTML
resourceTimespan.name: resourceTimespan

style.help: Style in CSS format that overrides a style defined in the Report Builder report at run time.
style.name: style

cfreport.help: Used to do either of the following: - Execute a report definition created with the ColdFusion Report Builder, displaying it in PDF, FlashPaper, or Excel format. You can optionally save this report to a file. - Run a predefined Crystal Reports report. Applies only to Windows systems. Uses the CFCRYSTAL.exe file to generate reports. Sets parameters in the Crystal Reports engine according to its attribute values.
cfreport.name: cfreport

name.help: Variable name for data that is passed. The ColdFusion Report Builder report definition must include an input parameter that matches this name.
name.name: name

value.help: Value of the data that is sent.
value.name: value

chart.help: Name of the chart contained in a report or subreport. The value of this attribute must match Name property of a chart defined in the Report Builder report.
chart.name: chart

query.help: Query value to pass to a subreport or chart. The ColdFusion query must contain at least all of the columns included in the Report Builder query.
query.name: query

series.help: Ordinal number of a chart series to use for the query. This attribute is valid only when the chart attribute is specified.
series.name: series

style.help: Style in CSS format for a subreport.
style.name: style

cfreportparam.help: Passes input parameters to a ColdFusion Report Builder report definition. Allowed inside cfreport tag bodies only.
cfreportparam.name: cfreportparam

cfrethrow.help: Rethrows the currently active exception. Preserves the exception's cfcatch.type and cfcatch.tagContext variable values.
cfrethrow.name: cfrethrow

cfreturn.help: Returns result values from a component method. Contains an expression returned as result of the function. An expression; the result of the function from which this tag is called.
cfreturn.name: cfreturn

variable.help: Name ofthe variable in which to save the generated content of the tag.
variable.name: variable

cfsavecontent (variable).help: Saves the generated content of the cfsavecontent tag, including the results of evaluating expressions and executing custom tags, in the specified variable.
cfsavecontent (variable).name: cfsavecontent

variable.help: Name ofthe variable in which to save the generated content of the tag.
variable.name: variable

cfsavecontent.help: Saves the generated content of the cfsavecontent tag, including the results of evaluating expressions and executing custom tags, in the specified variable.
cfsavecontent.name: cfsavecontent

action.help: delete: Deletes the specified task update: Updates an existing task or creates a new task, if one with the name specified by the task attribute does not exist run: Executes the specified task pause : If only groupname is specified all tasks of the group will be paused resume: If only groupname is specified all tasks of the group will be resumed list : Lists all the scheduled tasks pauseall : Pauses all scheduled tasks for a particular application resumeall : Resumes all scheduled tasks for a particular application
action.name: action

operation.help: Operation that the scheduler performs. Must be HTTPRequest.
operation.name: operation

file.help: Name of the file in which to store the published output of the scheuled task
file.name: file

path.help: Path to the directory in which to put the published file.
path.name: path

startdate.help: Date on which to first run the scheuled task.
startdate.name: startdate

starttime.help: Time at which to run the scheduled of task starts.
starttime.name: starttime

URL.help: URL of the page to execute.
URL.name: URL

port.help: Port to use on the server that is specified by the url parameter. If resolveURL = "yes", retrieved document URLs that specify a port number are automatically resolved, to preserve links in the retrieved document. A port value in the url attribute overrides this value.
port.name: port

publish.help: Yes: save the result to a file No: does not
publish.name: publish

interval.help: Interval at which task is scheduled. * number of seconds (minimum is 60) * once * daily * weekly * monthly
interval.name: interval

requesttimeout.help: Can be used to extend the default timeout period.
requesttimeout.name: requesttimeout

username.help: Username, if URL is protected.
username.name: username

password.help: Password, if URL is protected.
password.name: password

proxyserver.help: Host name or IP address of a proxy server.
proxyserver.name: proxyserver

proxyport.help: Port number to use on the proxy server.
proxyport.name: proxyport

proxyuser.help: User name to provide to the proxy server.
proxyuser.name: proxyuser

proxypassword.help: Password to provide to the proxy server.
proxypassword.name: proxypassword

resolveurl.help: Yes: resolve links in the output page to absolute references No: does not
resolveurl.name: resolveurl

group.help: The name of the group for the given task
group.name: group

onException.help: Action to be taken if the task throws an exception
onException.name: onException

repeat.help: Number of times the given task should be repeated
repeat.name: repeat

onComplete.help: Names of the tasks to be executed once this task is done
onComplete.name: onComplete

cronTime.help: Time at which the task is to be executed, in cron job syntax
cronTime.name: cronTime

priority.help: Priority of the task. Default is 5.
priority.name: priority

eventHandler.help: A cfc file whose pre-defined methods will be invoked for various events while running the task
eventHandler.name: eventHandler

exclude.help: Comma separated dates or date range which should be excluded from scheduling period
exclude.name: exclude

cluster.help: Decides whether the given task to be executed in cluster setup
cluster.name: cluster

onMisfire.help: Action to be taken if the task could not be executed at the scheduled time
onMisfire.name: onMisfire

retrycount.help: How many times to continue re-firing in case job execution throws an exception
retrycount.name: retrycount

mode.help: If it is server specific or application specific task
mode.name: mode

overwrite.help: Flag to indicate if log files should be overwritten when scheduled task executes
overwrite.name: overwrite

cfschedule.help: Provides a programmatic interface to the CFML scheduling engine. Can run a CFML page at scheduled intervals, with the option to write the page output to a static HTML page. This feature enables you to schedule pages that publish data, such as reports, without waiting while a database transaction is performed to populate the page.
cfschedule.name: cfschedule

cfscript.help: Encloses a code block that contains cfscript statements.  You cannot use some CFML reserved words in this tag. You cannot put a user-defined function whose name begins with any of these strings within this tag: cf,cf_,_cf,CFML,CFML_,_CFML
cfscript.name: cfscript

collection.help: One or more collection names. You can specify more than one collection unless you are performing a category search (that is, specifying category or categoryTree).  One or more collection names. You can specify more than one collection unless you are performing a category search (that is, specifying category or categoryTree).
collection.name: collection

category.help: A list of categories, separated by commas, to which the search is limited. If specified, and the collection does not have categories enabled, ColdFusion  throws an exception.
category.name: category

categorytree.help: The location in a hierarchical category tree at which to start the search. ColdFusion searches at and below this level. If specified, and the collection does not have categories enabled, ColdFusion throws an exception. Can be used in addition to category attribute.
categorytree.name: categorytree

status.help: Specifies the name of the structure variable into which ColdFusion places search information, including alternative criteria suggestions (spelling corrections).
status.name: status

type.help: Used to specify the parser that SOLR uses to process the criteria.
type.name: type

criteria.help: Search criteria. Follows the syntax rules of the type attribute. If you pass a mixed-case entry in this attribute, the search is case-sensitive. If you pass all uppercase or all lowercase, the search is case-insensitive.
criteria.name: criteria

maxrows.help: Maximum number of rows to return in query results. Default: all
maxrows.name: maxrows

startrow.help: First row number to get. Default: 1
startrow.name: startrow

suggestions.help: Specifies whether SOLR returns spelling suggestions for possibly misspelled words.
suggestions.name: suggestions

contextPassages.help: The number of passages/sentences Solr returns in the context summary (that is, the context column of the results). Default: 3
contextPassages.name: contextPassages

contextBytes.help: The maximum number of bytes Solr returns in the context summary. Default: 300
contextBytes.name: contextBytes

contextHighlightBegin.help: The HTML to prepend to search terms in the context summary. Use this attribute in conjunction with contextHighlightEnd to highlight search terms in the context summary. Default:
contextHighlightBegin.name: contextHighlightBegin

contextHighlightEnd.help: The HTML to prepend to search terms in the context summary. Use this attribute in conjunction with contextHighlightEnd to highlight search terms in the context summary. Default:
contextHighlightEnd.name: contextHighlightEnd

previousCriteria.help: The name of a result set from an existing set of search results. Solr searches the result set for criteria without regard to the previous search score or rank. Use this attribute to implement searching within result sets.
previousCriteria.name: previousCriteria

orderBy.help: Name of column(s), search result ahould be sorted by
orderBy.name: orderBy

searchcolumns.help: Specify column names in the search result
searchcolumns.name: searchcolumns

searchtime.help: Timeout value for the search operation
searchtime.name: searchtime

name.help: Name of the select form element
name.name: name

bind.help: A bind expression that dynamically sets an attribute of the control.
bind.name: bind

bindAttribute.help: Specifies the HTML tag attribute whose value is set by the bind attribute. You can only specify attributes in the browserâ€™s HTML DOM tree, not ColdFusion- specific attributes. Ignored if there is no bind attribute.
bindAttribute.name: bindAttribute

bindOnLoad.help: A Boolean value that specifies whether to execute the bind attribute expression when first loading the form. Ignored if there is no bind attribute.
bindOnLoad.name: bindOnLoad

editable.help: Boolean value specifying whether you can edit the contents of the control.
editable.name: editable

label.help: Label to put next to the control on a Flash or XML-format form.
label.name: label

style.help: In HTML or XML format forms, ColdFusion passes the style attribute to the browser or XML. In Flash format, must be a style specification in CSS format, with the same syntax and contents as used in Macromedia Flex for the corresponding Flash element. Post alpha we will document specifics.
style.name: style

sourceForTooltip.help: The URL of a page to display as a tool tip. The page can include CFML and HTML markup to control the tip contents and format, and the tip can include images. If you specify this attribute, an animated icon appears with the text "Loading..." while the tip is being loaded.
sourceForTooltip.name: sourceForTooltip

size.help: Number of entries to display at one time. The default, 1, displays a drop-down list. Any other value displays a list box with size number of entries visible at one time.
size.name: size

required.help: If true a list element must be selected when form is submitted. Note: This attribute has no effect if you omit the size attribute or set it to 1 because the browser always submits the displayed item. You can work around this issue format forms by having an initial option tag with value=" " (note the space character between the quotation marks). Default: false
required.name: required

message.help: Message to display if required="true" and no selection is made.
message.name: message

onerror.help: Custom JavaScript function to execute if validation fails.
onerror.name: onerror

multiple.help: - true: allow selecting multiple elements in drop-down list - false: don't allow selecting multiple elements Default: false
multiple.name: multiple

query.help: Name of query to populate drop-down list.
query.name: query

value.help: Query column to use for the value of each list element. Used with query attribute.
value.name: value

display.help: Query column to use for the display label of each list element. Used with query attribute.
display.name: display

group.help: Query column to use to group the items in the drop-down list into a two-level hierarchical list..
group.name: group

queryposition.help: If you populate the options list with a query and use HTML option child tags to specify additional entries, determines the location of the items from the query relative to the items from the option tags: - above: Put the query items above the options items. - below: Put the query items below the options items. Default: above
queryposition.name: queryposition

selected.help: One or more option values to preselect in the selection list. To specify multiple values, use a comma-delimited list. This attribute applies only if selection list items are generated from a query. The cfform preservedata attribute value can override this value.
selected.name: selected

onkeyup.help: JavaScript (HTML/XML) or ActionScript (Flash) to run when the user releases a keyboard key in the control.
onkeyup.name: onkeyup

onkeydown.help: JavaScript (HTML/XML) or ActionScript (Flash) ActionScript to run when the user depresses a keyboard key in the control.
onkeydown.name: onkeydown

onmouseup.help: JavaScript (HTML/XML) or ActionScript (Flash) to run when the user presses a mouse button in the control.
onmouseup.name: onmouseup

onmousedown.help: JavaScript (HTML/XML) or ActionScript (Flash) to run when the user releases a mouse button in the control.
onmousedown.name: onmousedown

onchange.help: JavaScript (HTML/XML) or ActionScript (Flash) to run when the control changes due to user action.
onchange.name: onchange

onclick.help: JavaScript to run when the user clicks the control.
onclick.name: onclick

enabled.help: Flash only: Boolean value specifying whether to show the control. Space that would be occupied by an invisible control is blank. Default: true
enabled.name: enabled

visible.help: Flash only: Boolean value specifying whether to show the control. Space that would be occupied by an invisible control is blank. Default: true
visible.name: visible

tooltip.help: Flash only: Text to display when the mouse pointer hovers over the control.
tooltip.name: tooltip

height.help: The height of the control, in pixels.
height.name: height

width.help: The width of the control, in pixels.
width.name: width

onbinderror.help: The name of a JavaScript function to execute if evaluating a bind expression results in an error. The function must take two attributes: an HTTP status code and a message.
onbinderror.name: onbinderror

cfset.help: Sets a value in CFML. Used to create a variable, if it does not exist, and assign it a value. Also used to call functions.
cfset.name: cfset

enablecfoutputonly.help: Yes: blocks output of HTML that is outside cfoutput tags No: displays HTML that is outside cfoutput tags.
enablecfoutputonly.name: enablecfoutputonly

showdebugoutput.help: Yes: If debugging is enabled in the Administrator, displays debugging information No: suppresses debugging information that would otherwise display at end of generated page.
showdebugoutput.name: showdebugoutput

requesttimeout.help: Integer; number of seconds. Time limit, after which CFML processes the page as an unresponsive thread. Overrides the timeout set in the CFML Administrator.
requesttimeout.name: requesttimeout

cfsetting.help: Controls aspects of page processing, such as the output of HTML code in pages.
cfsetting.name: cfsetting

cfsilent.help: Suppresses output produced by CFML within a tag's scope.
cfsilent.name: cfsilent

label.help: Label to display with control. For example, "Volume" This displays: "Volume %value%" To reference the value, use "%value%". If %% is omitted, slider value displays directly after label.
label.name: label

range.help: Numeric slider range values. Separate values with a comma.
range.name: range

scale.help: Unsigned integer. Defines slider scale, within range. For example: if range = "0,1000" and scale = "100", the display values are: 0, 100, 200, 300, ... Signed and unsigned integers in ColdFusion are in the range -2,147,483,648 to 2,147,483,647.
scale.name: scale

value.help: Starting slider setting. Must be within the range values.
value.name: value

onvalidate.help: Custom JavaScript function to validate user input; in this case, a change to the default slider value. Specify only the function name.
onvalidate.name: onvalidate

message.help: Message text to appear if validation fails.
message.name: message

height.help: Slider control height, in pixels.
height.name: height

width.help: Slider control width, in pixels.
width.name: width

vspace.help: Vertical spacing above and below slider, in pixels.
vspace.name: vspace

hspace.help: Horizontal spacing to left and right of slider, in pixels.
hspace.name: hspace

align.help: Alignment of slider: * top * left * bottom * baseline * texttop * absbottom * middle * absmiddle * right
align.name: align

lookandfeel.help: - motif: renders slider in Motif style - windows: renders slider in Windows style - metal: renders slider in Java Swing style If platform does not support style option, tag defaults to platform default style. Default: windows
lookandfeel.name: lookandfeel

vertical.help: Yes: Renders slider in browser vertically. You must set width and height attributes; ColdFusion does not automatically swap width and height values. No: Renders slider horizontally.
vertical.name: vertical

bgcolor.help: Background color of control. For a hex value, use the form: textColor = "##xxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two hash signs or none.
bgcolor.name: bgcolor

textcolor.help: Text color for control. For a hex value, use the form: textColor = "##xxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two hash signs or none.
textcolor.name: textcolor

font.help: Font name for data in tree control.
font.name: font

fontsize.help: Font size for text in tree control, in points.
fontsize.name: fontsize

italic.help: Yes: displays tree control text in italics No: it does not
italic.name: italic

bold.help: Yes: displays tree control text in bold No: it does not
bold.name: bold

notsupported.help: Text to display if a page that contains a Java applet-based cfform control is opened by a browser that does not support Java or has Java support disabled.
notsupported.name: notsupported
notsupported.default:
Browser must support Java to
view ColdFusion Java Applets!

onError.help: Custom JavaScript function to run if validation fails. Specify only the function name.

procedure.help: Name of stored procedure on database server.
procedure.name: procedure

datasource.help: Name of data source that points to database that contains stored procedure.

username.help: Overrides username in data source setup.

password.help: Overrides password in data source setup.

blockfactor.help: Maximum number of rows to get at a time from server. Range is 1 to 100.

returncode.help: Yes: Tag populates cfstoredproc.statusCode with status code returned by stored procedure. No: does not

clientinfo.name: clientinfo

timeout.help: Connection timeout value
timeout.name: timeout

cfstoredproc.help: Executes a stored procedure in a server database. It specifies database connection information and identifies the stored procedure.
cfstoredproc.name: cfstoredproc

expression.help: CFML expression that yields a scalar value. CFML converts integers, real numbers, Booleans, and dates to numeric values. For example, True, 1, and 1.0 are all equal.
expression.name: expression

cfswitch.help: Evaluates a passed expression and passes control to the cfcase tag that matches the expression result. You can, optionally, code a cfdefaultcase tag, which receives control if there is no matching cfcase tag value.
cfswitch.name: cfswitch

query.help: Name of cfquery from which to draw data.
query.name: query

maxrows.help: Maximum number of rows to display in the table.
maxrows.name: maxrows

headerLines.help: Number of lines to use for table header (the default leaves one line between header and first row of table).
headerLines.name: headerLines

htmltable.help: Renders data in an HTML 3.0 table.  If you use this attribute (regardless of its value), CFML renders data in an HTML table.
htmltable.name: htmltable

border.help: Displays border around table.  If you use this attribute (regardless of its value), CFML displays a border around the table.  Use this only if you use the HTMLTable attribute.
border.name: border

colheaders.help: Displays column heads. If you use this attribute, you must also use the cfcol tag header attribute to define them.  If you use this attribute (regardless of its value), CFML displays column heads.
colheaders.name: colheaders

startrow.help: The query result row to put in the first table row.
startrow.name: startrow

cftable (query).help: Builds a table in a CFML page. This tag renders data as preformatted text, or, with the HTMLTable attribute, in an HTML table. If you do not want to write HTML table tag code, or if your data can be presented as preformatted text, use this tag.  Preformatted text (defined in HTML with the  tags) displays text in a fixed-width font. It displays white space and line breaks exactly as they are written within the pre tags. For more information, see an HTML reference guide.  To define table column and row characteristics, use the cfcol tag within this tag.
cftable (query).name: cftable

query.help: Name of cfquery from which to draw data.
query.name: query

maxrows.help: Maximum number of rows to display in the table.
maxrows.name: maxrows

headerLines.help: Number of lines to use for table header (the default leaves one line between header and first row of table).
headerLines.name: headerLines

For more information, see an HTML reference guide.  To define table column and row characteristics, use the cfcol tag within this tag.
cftable.name: cftable

label.help: Label to put beside the control on a form.
label.name: label

style.help: In HTML or XML format forms, ColdFusion passes the style attribute to the browser or XML. In Flash format forms, must be a style specification in CSS format, with the same syntax and contents as used in Macromedia Flex for the corresponding Flash element.
style.name: style

required.help: - true: the field must contain text. - false: the field can be empty. Default: false
required.name: required

html.help: Boolean value that specifies whether the text area contains HTML. Default: false
html.name: html

validate.help: The type or types of validation to do. Available validation types and algorithms depend on the format. For details, see the Usage section of the cfinput tag reference.
validate.name: validate

validateat.help: How to do the validation. For Flash format forms, onSubmit and onBlur are identical; validation is done on submit. For multiple values, use a comma-delimited list. For details, see the Usage section of the cfinput tag reference. Default: onSubmit
validateat.name: validateat

message.help: Message text to display if validation fails.
message.name: message

range.help: Minimum and maximum numeric allowed values. ColdFusion uses this attribute only if you specify range in the validate attribute. If you specify a single number or a single number a followed by a comma, it is treated as a minimum, with no maximum. If you specify a comma followed by a number, the maximum is set to the specified number, with no minimum.
range.name: range

maxlength.help: The maximum length of text that can be entered. ColdFusion uses this attribute only if you specify maxlength in the validate attribute.
maxlength.name: maxlength

pattern.help: JavaScript regular expression pattern to validate input. Omit leading and trailing slashes. ColdFusion uses this attribute only if you specify regex in the validate attribute.
pattern.name: pattern

onvalidate.help: Custom JavaScript function to validate user input. The JavaScript DOM form object, input object, and input object value are passed to routine, which should return True if validation succeeds, False otherwise. If you specify this attribute, ColdFusion ignores the validate attribute.
onvalidate.name: onvalidate

onerror.help: Custom JavaScript function to execute if validation fails.
onerror.name: onerror

disabled.help: Disables user input, making the control read-only. To disable input, specify disabled without an attribute, or disabled="true". To enable input, omit the attribute or specify disabled="false". Default: false
disabled.name: disabled

help._: Initial value to display in text control. You can specify an initial value as an attribute or in the tag body, but not in both places. If you specify the value as an attribute, you must put the closing cftextarea tag immediately after the opening cftextarea tag, with no spaces or line feeds between, or place a closing slash at the end of the opening cftextarea tag. For example:

bind.help: Flash only: A Flex bind expression that populates the field with information from other form fields.
bind.name: bind

onkeyup.help: JavaScript (HTML/XML) or ActionScript (Flash) to run when the user releases a keyboard key in the control.
onkeyup.name: onkeyup

onkeydown.help: JavaScript (HTML/XML) or ActionScript (Flash) ActionScript to run when the user presses a keyboard key in the control.
onkeydown.name: onkeydown

onmouseup.help: JavaScript (HTML/XML) or ActionScript (Flash) to run when the user presses a mouse button in the control.
onmouseup.name: onmouseup

onmousedown.help: JavaScript (HTML/XML) or ActionScript (Flash) to run when the user releases a mouse button in the control.
onmousedown.name: onmousedown

onchange.help: JavaScript (HTML/XML) or ActionScript (Flash) to run when the control changes due to user action.
onchange.name: onchange

onclick.help: JavaScript (HTML/XML) to run when the user clicks the control. Not supported for Flash forms.
onclick.name: onclick

enabled.help: Flash only: Boolean value specifying whether the control is enabled. A disabled control appears in light gray. The inverse of the diabled attribute. Default: true
enabled.name: enabled

visible.help: Flash only: Boolean value specifying whether to show the control. Space that would be occupied by an invisible control is blank. Default: true
visible.name: visible

tooltip.help: Flash only: Text to display when the mouse pointer hovers over the control.
tooltip.name: tooltip

toolbar.help: Specifies the rich text editor toolbar. By default, the valid values for this attribute are: Default, a complete set of controls, and Basic, a minimal configuration. You can add configurations. This attribute's value is case sensitive.
toolbar.name: toolbar

height.help: Flash only: The height of the control, in pixels.
height.name: height

width.help: Flash only: The width of the control, in pixels.
width.name: width

basepath.help: Path to the directory that contains the rich text editor. The editor configuration files are at the top level of this directory.
basepath.name: basepath

bindattribute.help: Specifies the HTML tag attribute whose value is set by the bind attribute. You can only specify attributes in the browser's HTML DOM tree, not ColdFusion-specific attributes.
bindattribute.name: bindattribute

bindonload.help: A Boolean value that specifies whether to execute the bind attribute expression when first loading the form.
bindonload.name: bindonload

fontformats.help: A comma separated list of the font names to display in the rich text editor Formats selector. The formats specify the HTML tags to apply to typed or selected text.
fontformats.name: fontformats

fontnames.help: A comma separated list of the font names to display in the rich text editor Font selector.
fontnames.name: fontnames

fontsizes.help: A comma separated list of the font sizes to display in the rich text editor Size selector. List entries must have the format of numeric font size/descriptive text.
fontsizes.name: fontsizes

onbinderror.help: The name of a JavaScript function to execute if evaluating a bind expression results in an error. The function must take two attributes: an HTTP status code and a message.
onbinderror.name: onbinderror

richtext.help: A Boolean value specifying whether this control is a rich text editor with tool bars to control the text formatting.
richtext.name: richtext

skin.help: Specifies the skin to be used for the rich text editor. By default, the valid values are Default, silver, and office2003. You can also create custom skins that you can then specify in this attribute.
skin.name: skin

wrap.help: *  hard: wraps long lines, and sends the carriage return to the server. * off: does not wrap long lines. * physical: wraps long lines, and transmits the text at all wrap points. * soft: wraps long lines, but does not send the carriage return to the server. * virtual: wraps long lines, but does not send the carriage return to the server.
wrap.name: wrap

sourcefortooltip.help: The URL of a page to display as a tool tip. The page can include CFML and HTML to control the contents and format, and the tip can include images. If you specify this attribute, an animated icon appears with the text "Loading..." while the tip is being loaded.
sourcefortooltip.name: sourcefortooltip

stylesxml.help: The path of the file that defines the styles in the rich text editor Styles selector. Relative paths start at the directory that contains the fckeditor.html file, normally cf_webRoot/CFIDE/scripts/ajax/FCKeditor/editor.
stylesxml.name: stylesxml

templatesxml.help: The pathof the file that defines the templates that are displayed when you click the rich text editor Templates icon.
templatesxml.name: templatesxml

toolbaronfocus.help: A Boolean value that specifies whether the rich text editor toolbar expands and displays its controls only when the rich text editor has the focus.
toolbaronfocus.name: toolbaronfocus

secureUpload.help: If true, enables secure upload using FCKeditor. For secure upload, you must have sessionManagement set to yes. Secure upload does not work if sessionManagement is set to false.
secureUpload.name: secureUpload
