cftextarea.name: cftextarea

type.help: * A custom type * Application Do not enter another predefined type; types are not generated by CFML applications. If you specify Application, you need not specify a type for cfcatch.
type.name: type

message.help: Message that describes exception event.
message.name: message

detail.help: Description of the event. CFML appends error position to description; server uses this parameter if an error is not caught by your code.
detail.name: detail

errorcode.help: A custom error code that you supply.
errorcode.name: errorcode

extendedinfo.help: A custom error code that you supply.
extendedinfo.name: extendedinfo

object.help: Requires the value of the cfobject tag name attribute.  Throws a Java exception from a CFML tag.  This attribute is mutually exclusive with all other attributes of this tag.
object.name: object

cfthrow.help: Throws a developer-specified exception, which can be caught with a cfcatch tag that has any of the following type attribute options: type = "custom_type" type = "Application" type = "Any"
cfthrow.name: cfthrow

label.help: Label to display with timing information. Default: " "
label.name: label

type.help: - inline: displays timing information inline, following the resulting HTML. - outline: displays timing information and also displays a line around the output produced by the timed code. The browser must support the FIELDSET tag to display the outline. - comment: displays timing information in an HTML comment in the format . The default label is cftimer. - debug: displays timing information in the debug output under the heading CFTimer Times. Default: debug
type.name: type

cftimer.help: Displays execution time for a specified section of CFML code. ColdFusion MX displays the timing information along with any output produced by the timed code.
cftimer.name: cftimer

abort.help: Calls cfabort tag when the tag is executed
abort.name: abort

category.help: User-defined string for identifying trace groups
category.name: category

inline.help: Displays trace code in line on the page in the location of the cftrace tag, addition to the debugging information output.
inline.name: inline

text.help: User-defined string, which can include simple variable, but not complex variables such as arrays. Outputs to cflog text attribute
text.name: text

type.help: Corresponds to the cflog type attribute; displays an appropriate icon.  * Information * Warning * Error * Fatal Information
type.name: type

var.help: The name of a simple or complex variable to display.  Useful for displaying a temporary value, or a value that does not display on any CFM page.
var.name: var

cftrace.help: Displays and logs debugging data about the state of an application at the time the cftrace tag executes. Tracks runtime logic flow, variable values, and execution time. Displays output at the end of the request or in the debugging section at the end of the request;  CFML logs cftrace output to the file logs\cftrace.log, in the CFML installation directory.  Note: To permit this tag to execute, you must enable debugging in the CFML Administrator. Optionally, to report trace summaries, enable the Trace section.
cftrace.name: cftrace

li: begin: the start of the block of code to execute
commit: commits a pending transaction
rollback: rolls back a pending transaction

savepoint.help: The name of the savepoint in the transaction.
savepoint.name: savepoint

nested.help: Specifies whether transaction is nested or not
nested.name: nested

cftransaction.help: Instructs the database management system to treat multiple database operations as a single transaction. Provides database commit and rollback processing.
cftransaction.name: cftransaction

format.help: - applet: displays the tree using a Java applet in the browser, - flash: displays the tree using a Flash control - object: returns the tree as a ColdFusion structure with the name specified by the name attribute, For details of the structure contents, see "object format", below. - xml: Generates an XMLrepresentation of the tree. In XML format forms, includes the generated XML in the form. and puts the XML in a string variable with the name specified by the name attribute. Default: applet
format.name: format

required.help: - true: user must select an item in tree control - false: they do not Default: false
required.name: required

delimiter.help: Character to separate elements in form variable path. Default: \\
delimiter.name: delimiter

completepath.help: - true: start the Form.treename.path variable with the root of the tree path when cftree is submitted. - false: omit the root level from the Form.treename.path variable; the value starts with the first child node in the tree. For the preserveData attribute of cfform to work with the tree, you must set this attribute to Yes. For tree items populated by a query, if you use the cftreeitem queryasroot attribute to specify a root name, that value is returned. If you do not specify a root name, ColdFusion returns the query name. Default: false
completepath.name: completepath

appendkey.help: - true: if you use cftreeitem href attributes, ColdFusion appends a CFTREEITEMKEY query string variable with the value of the selected tree item to the cfform action URL. - false: do not append the tree item value to the URL. Default: true
appendkey.name: appendkey

highlighthref.help: - true: highlights as a link the displayed value for any cftreeitem tag that specifies a href attribute. - false: disables highlighting. Default: true
highlighthref.name: highlighthref

onvalidate.help: JavaScript function to validate user input. The form object, input object, and input object value are passed to the specified routine, which should return True if validation succeeds; False, otherwise.
onvalidate.name: onvalidate

message.help: Message to display if validation fails.
message.name: message

onerror.help: JavaScript function to execute if validation fails.
onerror.name: onerror

lookandfeel.help: - motif: renders slider in Motif style - windows: renders slider in Windows style - metal: renders slider in Java Swing style If platform does not support style option, tag defaults to platform default style. Default: windows
lookandfeel.name: lookandfeel

font.help: Font name for data in tree control.
font.name: font

fontsize.help: Font size for text in tree control, in points.
fontsize.name: fontsize

italic.help: - true: displays tree control text in italics - false: it does not Default: false
italic.name: italic

bold.help: - true: displays tree control text in bold - false: it does not Default: false
bold.name: bold

height.help: Tree control height, in pixels. If you omit this attribute in Flash format, Flash automatically sizes the tree. Default: 320 (applet only)
height.name: height

width.help: Tree control width, in pixels. If you omit this attribute in Flash format, Flash automatically sizes the tree. Default: 200 (applet only)
width.name: width

vspace.help: Vertical margin above and below tree control, in pixels.
vspace.name: vspace

hspace.help: Horizontal spacing to left and right of tree control, in pixels.
hspace.name: hspace

align.help: Alignment of the tree control applet object.
align.name: align

border.help: - true: display a border around the tree control. - false: no border Default: true
border.name: border

hscroll.help: - true: permits horizontal scrolling - false: no horizontal scrolling Default: true
hscroll.name: hscroll

vscroll.help: - true: permits vertical scrolling - false: no vertical scrolling Default: true
vscroll.name: vscroll

style.help: Flash only: Must be a style specification in CSS format, with the same syntax and contents as used in Macromedia Flex for the corresponding Flash element.
style.name: style

enabled.help: Flash only: Boolean value specifying whether the control is enabled. A disabled control appears in light gray. Default: true
enabled.name: enabled

visible.help: Flash only: Boolean value specifying whether to show the control. Space that would be occupied by an invisible control is blank. Default: true
visible.name: visible

tooltip.help: Flash only: Text to display when the mouse pointer hovers over the control.
tooltip.name: tooltip

onchange.help: Flash only: ActionScript to run when the control changes due to user action. If you specify an onChange event handler, the Form scope of the ColdFusion action page does not automatically get information about selected items. The ActionScript onChange event handler must handle all changes and selections.
onchange.name: onchange

onblur.help: Flash only: ActionScript that runs when the calendar loses focus. (Added in 7.0.1)
onblur.name: onblur

onfocus.help: Flash only: ActionScript that runs when the calendar loses focus. (Added in 7.0.1)
onfocus.name: onfocus

notsupported.help: Text to display if a page that contains a Java applet-based cfform control is opened by a browser that does not support Java or has Java support disabled.

Browser must support Java to
view ColdFusion Java Applets!

value.help: Valid when format="HTML"

onerror.help: JavaScript function to execute if validation fails.
onerror.name: onerror

lookandfeel.help: - motif: renders slider in Motif style - windows: renders slider in Windows style - metal: renders slider in Java Swing style If platform does not support style option, tag defaults to platform default style. Default: windows
lookandfeel.name: lookandfeel

font.help: Font name for data in tree control.
font.name: font

fontsize.help: Font size for text in tree control, in points.
fontsize.name: fontsize

italic.help: - true: displays tree control text in italics - false: it does not Default: false
italic.name: italic

bold.help: - true: displays tree control text in bold - false: it does not Default: false
bold.name: bold

height.help: Tree control height, in pixels. If you omit this attribute in Flash format, Flash automatically sizes the tree. Default: 320 (applet only)
height.name: height

width.help: Tree control width, in pixels. If you omit this attribute in Flash format, Flash automatically sizes the tree. Default: 200 (applet only)
width.name: width

vspace.help: Vertical margin above and below tree control, in pixels.
vspace.name: vspace

hspace.help: Horizontal spacing to left and right of tree control, in pixels.
hspace.name: hspace

align.help: Alignment of the tree control applet object.
align.name: align

border.help: - true: display a border around the tree control. - false: no border Default: true
border.name: border

hscroll.help: - true: permits horizontal scrolling - false: no horizontal scrolling Default: true
hscroll.name: hscroll

vscroll.help: - true: permits vertical scrolling - false: no vertical scrolling Default: true
vscroll.name: vscroll

style.help: Flash only: Must be a style specification in CSS format, with the same syntax and contents as used in Macromedia Flex for the corresponding Flash element.
style.name: style

enabled.help: Flash only: Boolean value specifying whether the control is enabled. A disabled control appears in light gray. Default: true
enabled.name: enabled

visible.help: Flash only: Boolean value specifying whether to show the control. Space that would be occupied by an invisible control is blank. Default: true
visible.name: visible

tooltip.help: Flash only: Text to display when the mouse pointer hovers over the control.
tooltip.name: tooltip

onchange.help: Flash only: ActionScript to run when the control changes due to user action. If you specify an onChange event handler, the Form scope of the ColdFusion action page does not automatically get information about selected items. The ActionScript onChange event handler must handle all changes and selections.
onchange.name: onchange

onblur.help: Flash only: ActionScript that runs when the calendar loses focus. (Added in 7.0.1)
onblur.name: onblur

onfocus.help: Flash only: ActionScript that runs when the calendar loses focus. (Added in 7.0.1)
onfocus.name: onfocus

notsupported.help: Text to display if a page that contains a Java applet-based cfform control is opened by a browser that does not support Java or has Java support disabled.
notsupported.name: notsupported
notsupported.default:
Browser must support Java to
view ColdFusion Java Applets!

cache.help: A Boolean value that specifies whether to get new data each time the user expands tree nodes, as follows: * yes: fetches a node's child items only once, when the node is first expanded * no: fetches child items each time the node is expanded.
cache.name: cache

value.help: Valid when format="HTML"
value.name: value

cftree.help: Inserts a tree control in a form. Validates user selections. Used within a cftree tag block. You can use a CFML query to supply data to the tree.
cftree.name: cftree

bind.help: A bind expression specifying a CFC of JavaScript function that dynamically gets all tree nodes. You can use this attribute only at the top level of the tree, and in this case, the tree can have only cftreeitem tag. If you use the bind attribute, the only other allowed attribute is onBindError. For details creating trees that using binding, see "Using HTML format trees" in Chapter 33, "Using AJAX UI Components and Features" in ColdFusion Developer's Guide
bind.name: bind

value.help: Value passed when cfform is submitted. When populating a tree with data from a cfquery, specify columns in a delimited list. Example: value = "dept_id,emp_id"
value.name: value

display.help: Tree item label. When populating a tree with data from a query, specify names in a delimited list. Example: display = "dept_name,emp_name"
display.name: display

img.help: Image name, filename, or file URL for tree item icon.  You can specify a custom image. To do so, include path and file extension; for example:  img = "../images/page1.gif"  To specify more than one image in a tree, or an image at the second or subsequent level, use commas to separate names, corresponding to level; for example:   img = "folder,document" img = ",document" (example of second level)
img.name: img

imgopen.help: Icon displayed with open tree item. You can specify icon filename with a relative path. You can use a CFML image.
imgopen.name: imgopen

href.help: URL to associate with tree item or query column for a tree that is populated from a query. If href is a query column, its value is the value populated by query. If href is not recognized as a query column, it is assumed that its text is an HTML href.  When populating a tree with data from a query, HREFs can be specified in delimited list; for example:  href = "http://dept_svr,http://emp_svr"
href.name: href

target.help: Target attribute of href URL. When populating a tree with data from a query, specify target in delimited list:  target = "FRAME_BODY,_blank"
target.name: target

query.help: Query name to generate data for the treeitem.
query.name: query

queryAsRoot.help: Defines query as the root level. This avoids having to create another parent cftreeitem.  * Yes * No * String to use as the root name If you do not specify a root name, CFML returns the query name as the root.
queryAsRoot.name: queryAsRoot

expand.help: Yes: expands tree to show tree item children No: keeps tree item collapsed
expand.name: expand

onbinderror.help: The name of a JavaScript function to execute if evaluating a bind expression results in an error. The function must take two attributes: an HTTP status code and a message.
onbinderror.name: onbinderror

cftreeitem.help: Populates a form tree control, created with the cftree tag, with elements. To display icons, you can use the img values that CFML provides, or reference your own icons.
cftreeitem.name: cftreeitem

cftry.help: Used with one or more cfcatch tags. Together, they catch and process exceptions in CFML pages. Exceptions are events that disrupt the normal flow of instructions in a CFML page, such as failed database operations, missing include files, and developer-specified events.
cftry.name: cftry

datasource.help: Name of the data source that contains the table
datasource.name: datasource

tablename.help: Name of table to update. For ORACLE drivers, must be uppercase. For Sybase driver: case-sensitive; must be in same case as used when the table was created
tablename.name: tablename

tableowner.help: For data sources that support table ownership (for example, SQL Server, Oracle, Sybase SQL Anywhere), the table owner.
tableowner.name: tableowner

tablequalifier.help: For data sources that support table qualifiers. The purpose of table qualifiers is as follows: SQL Server and Oracle: name of database that contains table Intersolv dBASE driver: directory of DBF files
tablequalifier.name: tablequalifier

username.help: Overrides username value specified in ODBC setup.
username.name: username

password.help: Overrides password value specified in ODBC setup.
password.name: password

formfields.help: Comma-delimited list of form fields to update.  If a form field is not matched by a column name in the database, CFML throws an error.  The formFields lies must include the database table primary key field, which must be present in the form. It can be hidden.
formfields.name: formfields

clientinfo.help: Struct containing Clientinfo properties to be set on the database connection
clientinfo.name: clientinfo

cfupdate (tablename).help: Updates records in a data source from data in a CFML form or form Scope.
cfupdate (tablename).name: cfupdate

datasource.help: Name of the data source that contains the table
datasource.name: datasource

tablename.help: Name of table to update. For ORACLE drivers, must be uppercase. For Sybase driver: case-sensitive; must be in same case as used when the table was created
tablename.name: tablename

tableowner.help: For data sources that support table ownership (for example, SQL Server, Oracle, Sybase SQL Anywhere), the table owner.
tableowner.name: tableowner

tablequalifier.help: For data sources that support table qualifiers. The purpose of table qualifiers is as follows: SQL Server and Oracle: name of database that contains table Intersolv dBASE driver: directory of DBF files
tablequalifier.name: tablequalifier

username.help: Overrides username value specified in ODBC setup.
username.name: username

password.help: Overrides password value specified in ODBC setup.
password.name: password

formfields.help: Comma-delimited list of form fields to update.  If a form field is not matched by a column name in the database, CFML throws an error.  The formFields lies must include the database table primary key field, which must be present in the form. It can be hidden.
formfields.name: formfields

clientinfo.help: Struct containing Clientinfo properties to be set on the database connection
clientinfo.name: clientinfo

cfupdate.help: Updates records in a data source from data in a CFML form or form Scope.
cfupdate.name: cfupdate

action.help: cfml2wddx: serialize CFML to WDDX wddx2cfml: deserialize WDDX to CFML cfml2js: serialize CFML to JavaScript wddx2js: deserialize WDDX to JavaScript
action.name: action

output.help: Name of variable for output. If action = "WDDX2JS" or "CFML2JS", and this attribute is omitted, result is output in HTML stream.
output.name: output

toplevelvariable.help: Name of top-level JavaScript object created by deserialization. The object is an instance of the WddxRecordset object.
toplevelvariable.name: toplevelvariable

usetimezoneinfo.help: Whether to output time-zone information when serializing CFML to WDDX. - Yes: the hour-minute offset, represented in ISO8601 format, is output. - No: the local time is output.
usetimezoneinfo.name: usetimezoneinfo

validate.help: Applies if action = "wddx2cfml" or "wddx2js". - Yes: validates WDDX input with an XML parser using WDDX DTD. If parser processes input without error, packet is deserialized. Otherwise, an error is thrown. - No: no input validation
validate.name: validate

cfwddx.help: Serializes and deserializes CFML data structures to the XML-based WDDX format. The WDDX is an XML vocabulary for describing complex data structures in a standard, generic way. Implementing it lets you use the HTTP protocol to such information among application server platforms, application servers, and browsers.  This tag generates JavaScript statements to instantiate JavaScript objects equivalent to the contents of a WDDX packet or CFML data structure. Interoperates with Unicode.
cfwddx.name: cfwddx

bodyStyle.help: A CSS style specification for the window body. As a general rule, use this attribute to set color and font styles. Using this attribute to set the height and width, for example, can result in distorted output.
bodyStyle.name: bodyStyle

center.help: A Boolean value specifying whether to center the window over the browser window. â€¢ If true, ColdFusion ignores the x and y attribute values. â€¢ If false, and you do not specify x and y attributes, ColdFusion centers the window.
center.name: center

closable.help: A Boolean value specifying whether the user can close the window. If true, the window has an X close icon.
closable.name: closable

draggable.help: A Boolean value specifying whether the user can drag the window. To drag the window, click the mouse on the title bar and hold the button down while dragging. If the window does not have a title, users cannot drag it.
draggable.name: draggable

headerStyle.help: A CSS style specification for the window header. As a general rule, use this attribute to set color and font styles. Using this attribute to set the height and width, for example, can result in distorted output.
headerStyle.name: headerStyle

height.help: Height of the window in pixels. If you specify a value greater than the available space, the window occupies the available space and the resize handles do not appear.  Default is 300.
height.name: height

initShow.help: A Boolean value specifying whether to display the window when the containing page first displays. If this value is false, use the ColdFusion.Layout.show JavaScript function to display the window.
initShow.name: initShow

minHeight.help: The minimum height, in pixels, to which users can resize the window. Default is 0.
minHeight.name: minHeight

minWidth.help: The minimum width, in pixels, to which users can resize the window.  Default is 0.
minWidth.name: minWidth

modal.help: A Boolean value specifying whether the window is modal, that is, whether the user can interact with the main window while this window displays. If true, the user cannot interact with the main window.
modal.name: modal

name.help: The name of the window. Must be unique on the pages. This attribute is required to interact with the window, including to dynamically show or hide it.
name.name: name

onBindError.help: The name of a JavaScript function to execute if evaluating a bind expression results in an error. The function must take two attributes: an HTTP status code and a message. If you omit this attribute, and have specified a global error handler (by using the ColdFusion.setGlobalErrorHandlerfunction ), it displays the error message; otherwise a default error pop-up displays.
onBindError.name: onBindError

resizable.help: A Boolean value specifying whether the user can resize the window.
resizable.name: resizable

source.help: A URL that returns the window contents. This attribute can use URL parameters to pass data to the page. ColdFusion uses standard page path resolution rules to locate the page. You can use a bind expressions in this attribute; for more information see the Usage section. Note: If a CFML page specified in this attribute contains tags that use AJAX features, such as cfform, cfgrid, and cfpod, you must use a cfajaximport tag on the page with the cfwindow tag. For more information, see cfajaximport
source.name: source

title.help: Text to display in the window's title bar. You can use HTML mark up to control the title appearance, of example to show the text in red italic font. If you omit this attribute, the window does not have a title bar.
title.name: title

width.help: Width of the control, including the title bar and borders, in pixels.  Default is 500.
width.name: width

x.help: The X (horizontal) coordinate of the upper-left corner of the window, relative to the browser window. ColdFusion ignores this attribute if the center attribute value is true and if you do not set the y attribute value.
x.name: x

y.help: The Y (vertical) coordinate of the upper-left corner of the window, relative to the browser window. ColdFusion ignores this attribute if the center attribute value is true and if you do not set the x attribute value.
y.name: y

refreshonshow.help: *  true Refresh the contents of the window by running the source bind expression whenever the window shows (for example, by calling the ColdFusion.Window.show JavaScript function), in addition to when bind events occur * false  Refresh the window only when the bind expression is triggered by its bind event.
refreshonshow.name: refreshonshow

destroyOnClose.help: When destroyOnClose is true, destroys the window when it is closed. By default, this is is false and the window is hidden when it is closed.
destroyOnClose.name: destroyOnClose

cfwindow.help: Creates a pop-up window in the browser. Does not create a separate browser pop-up instance.
cfwindow.name: cfwindow

casesensitive.help: Maintains the case of document elements and attributes
casesensitive.name: casesensitive

cfxml.help: Creates a CFML XML document object that contains the markup in the tag body. This tag can include XML and CFML tags. CFML processes the CFML code in the tag body, then assigns the resulting text to an XML document object variable.
cfxml.name: cfxml

scriptsrc.help: Specifies the URL, relative to the web root, of the directory that contains the JavaScript files used used by ColdFusion. When you use this attribute, the specified directory must have the same structure as the /CFIDE/scripts directory.
scriptsrc.name: scriptsrc

csssrc.help: Specifies the URL, relative to the web root, of the directory that contains the CSS files used by ColdFusion AJAX features, with the exception of the rich text editor. This directory must have the same directory structure, and contain the same CSS files, and image files required by the CSS files, as the web_root/CFIDE/scripts/ajax/resources directory. This attribute lets you create different custom styles for ColdFusion AJAX controls in different applications.
csssrc.name: csssrc

tags.help: A comma-delimited list of tags or tag-attribute combinations for which to import the supporting JavaScript files on this page.
tags.name: tags

cfajaximport.help: Controls the JavaScript files that are imported for use on pages that use ColdFusion AJAX tags and features.
cfajaximport.name: cfajaximport

bgcolor.help: The color of the menu background. You can use any valid HTML color specification. This specification is locally overridden by the menuStyle attribute of this tag and any cfmenuitem tag, but does affect the background of the surrounding color of a submenu whose background is controlled by a childStyle attribute
bgcolor.name: bgcolor

childstyle.help: A CSS style specification that applies to the items of the top level menu and all child menu items, including the children of submenus. This attribute lets you use a single style specification for all menu items.
childstyle.name: childstyle

font.help: The font to be use for all child menu items. You can use any valid HTML font-family style attribute.
font.name: font

fontcolor.help: The color of the menu text. You can use any valid HTML color specification.
fontcolor.name: fontcolor

fontsize.help: The size of the font. Use a numeric value, such as 8, to specify a pixel character size. Use a percentage value, such as 80% to specify a size relative to the default font size. Font sizes over 20 pixels can result in submenu text exceeding the menu boundary.
fontsize.name: fontsize

menustyle.help: A CSS style specification that applies to the menu, including any parts of the menu that do not have items. If you do not specify style information in the cfmenuitem tags, this attribute controls the style of the top-level items.
menustyle.name: menustyle

selectedfontcolor.help: The color of the text for the menu item that has the focus. You can use any valid HTML color specification.
selectedfontcolor.name: selectedfontcolor

selecteditemcolor.help: The color that highlights the menu item that has the focus. You can use any valid HTML color specification.
selecteditemcolor.name: selecteditemcolor

type.help: The orientation of menu.
type.name: type

width.help: The width of a vertical menu; not valid for horizontal menus.
width.name: width

cfmenu.help: Creates a menu or tool bar (a horizontally arranged menu). Any menu item can be the top level of a submenu.
cfmenu.name: cfmenu

display.help: The text to show as the menu item label.
display.name: display

childstyle.help: A CSS style specification that applies to all child menu items, including the children of submenus.
childstyle.name: childstyle

divider.help: This attribute specifies that the item is a divider. If you specify this attribute, you cannot specify any other attributes.
divider.name: divider

href.help: A URL link to activate or JavaScript function to call when the user clicks the menu item.
href.name: href

image.help: URL of an image to display at the left side of the menu item. The file type can be any format the browser can display. For most displays, you should use 15x15 pixel images, because larger images conflict with the menu item text
image.name: image

menustyle.help: A CSS style specification that controls the overall style of any submenu of this menu item. This attribute controls the submenu of the current menu item, but not to any child submenus of the submenu.
menustyle.name: menustyle

name.help: The name of the menu item.
name.name: name

style.help: A CSS style specification that applies to the current menu item only. It is not overridden by the childStyle attribute.
style.name: style

target.help: The target in which to display the contents returned by the href attribute. The attribute can be a browser window or frame name, an HTML target value, such as _self.
target.name: target

cfmenuitem.help: Defines an entry in a menu, including an item that is the head of a submenu.
cfmenuitem.name: cfmenuitem

source.help: Source document to print. You can specify one of the following: â€¢ An absolute or relative pathname to a PDF document; for example, c:\work\myPDF.pdf or myPDF.pdf. The default directory is the template directory. â€¢ A PDF document variable in memory that is generated by the cfdocument tag or the cfpdf tag; for example, "myPDFdoc".
source.name: source

attributestruct.help: ColdFusion structure used to specify additional print instructions. Individually named attributes take precedence over the key-value pairs in the attribute structure.
attributestruct.name: attributestruct

copies.help: Number of copies to print. The value must be greater than or equal to 1.
copies.name: copies

jobname.help: The name of a print job.
jobname.name: jobname

orientation.help: Orientation of the page to be printed.
orientation.name: orientation

pages.help: Pages in the source file to print. Duplicate pages and pages beyond the total count of pages in the document are ignored as long as there is at least one page between 1 and the total number of pages in the document. You can combine individual page numbers and page ranges; for example, 1â€“3,6,10â€“20. If you do not specify a value for the pages attribute, ColdFusion prints the entire document.
pages.name: pages

password.help: Specifies either the owner or user password for the PDF source file. If the PDF file is password-protected, you must specify this attribute for the file to print.
password.name: password

papersize.help: Paper used for the print job. The value can be any returned by the GetPrinterInfo function. Valid
papersize.name: papersize

quality.help: Print quality for the print job:  * draft * high * normal
quality.name: quality

coverpage.help: Specifies which job start and end sheets, if any, are printed with a job:  * none * standard
coverpage.name: coverpage

type.help: Specifies the file type of the document being printed. PDF is the only valid value.
type.name: type

printer.help: The name of a printer. An example in Windows is â€œ\\s1001prn02\NTN-2W- HP_BW02â€. The default is the default printer for the account where the ColdFusion server is running.
printer.name: printer

paper.help: Paper used for the print job. The value can be any returned by the GetPrinterInfo function.
paper.name: paper

fidelity.help: Whether to print a job based on the print requirements specified. Valid values are: * yes: if the job cannot be printed exactly as specified in the print requirements, the job is rejected. * no: a reasonable attempt to print the job is acceptable
fidelity.name: fidelity

cfprint.help: Prints specified pages from a PDF file. Use this tag to perform automated batch print jobs. You can use the cfprint tag to print any PDF document, including those generated by the cfdocument, cfpdf, and cfpdfform tag. Also, you can use this tag to print Report Builder reports exported in PDF format.
cfprint.name: cfprint

bind.help: A bind expression that returns XML data to populate the Spry data set. The bind expression can specify a CFC function or URL and can include bind parameters that represent the values of ColdFusion controls. For detailed information on specifying bind expressions, see HTML form data binding in cfinput.
bind.name: bind

name.help: The name of the Spry data set.
name.name: name

onbinderror.help: The name of a JavaScript function to execute if evaluating the bind expression results in an error. The function must take two attributes: an HTTP status code and a message. If you omit this attribute, and have specified a global error handler (by using the ColdFusion.setGlobalErrorHandler function), the handler displays the error message; otherwise a default error pop-up displays.
onbinderror.name: onbinderror

options.help: A JavaScript object containing options to pass to the data set.
options.name: options

type.help: Specifies data set type, corresponding to the format of the data that is returned by the bind expression.
type.name: type

xpath.help: Valid for XML type data sets only. An XPath expression that extracts data from the XML returned by the bind expression. The data set contains only the data that matches the xpath expression.
xpath.name: xpath

cfsprydataset.help: Creates a Spry data set; can use bind parameters to get data from ColdFusion AJAX controls to populate the data set.
cfsprydataset.name: cfsprydataset

preventoverlap.help: A Boolean value specifying whether to prevent the tooltip from overlapping the component that it describes.
preventoverlap.name: preventoverlap

autodismissdelay.help: The number of milliseconds between the time when the user moves the mouse pointer over the component (and leaves it there) and when the tooltip disappears.
autodismissdelay.name: autodismissdelay

hidedelay.help: The number of milliseconds to delay between the time when the user moves the mouse pointer away from the component and when the tooltip disappears.
hidedelay.name: hidedelay

showdelay.help: The number of milliseconds to delay between the time when the user moves the mouse over the component and when the tooltip appears.
showdelay.name: showdelay

sourcefortooltip.help: The URL of a page with the tool tip contents. The page can include HTML markup to control the format, and the tip can include images. If you specify this attribute, an animated icon appears with the text "Loading..." while the tip is being loaded.
sourcefortooltip.name: sourcefortooltip

tooltip.help: Tip text to display. The text can include HTML formatting. Ignored if you specify a sourceForTooltip attribute
tooltip.name: tooltip

cftooltip.help: Specifies tool tip text that displays when the user hovers the mouse pointer over the elements in the tag body. This tag does not require a form and is not used inside Flash forms.
cftooltip.name: cftooltip

cfc.help: The CFC for which to create a proxy. You must specify a dot-delimited path to the CFC. The path can be absolute or relative to location of the CFML page. For example, if the myCFC CFC is in the cfcs subdirectory of the ColdFusion page, specify cfcs.myCFC. On UNIX based systems, the tag searches first for a file whos name or path corresponds to the specified name or path, but is in all lower case. If it does not find it, ColdFusion then searches for a file name or path that coresponds to the attribute value exactly, with identical character casing. (required)
cfc.name: cfc

jsclassname.help: The name to use for the JavaScript proxy class. (optional)
jsclassname.name: jsclassname

bind.help: A bind expression that specifies a CFC method, JavaScript function, or URL to call.
bind.name: bind

onerror.help: The name of a JavaScript function to invoke when a bind, specified by the bind attribute fails. The function must take two arguments: an error code and an error message.
onerror.name: onerror

onsuccess.help: The name of a JavaScript function to invoke when a bind, specified by the bind attribute succeeds. The function must take one argument, the bind function return value. If the bind function is a CFC function, the return value is automatically converted to a JavaScript variable before being passed to the onSuccess function.
onsuccess.name: onsuccess

cfajaxproxy.help: Creates a JavaScript proxy for a ColdFusion component, for use in an AJAX client.
cfajaxproxy.name: cfajaxproxy

action.help: The action to take. Must be one of the following: create, delete, get, getAttachments, modify, respond (required)
action.name: action

attachmentpath.help: The file path of the destination directory. If the directory does not exist, ColdFusion creates it. If you omit this attribute, ColdFusion does not save any attachments. If you specify a relative path, the path root is the ColdFusion temporary directory, which is returned by the GetTempDirectory function. (optional)
attachmentpath.name: attachmentpath

connection.help: The name of the connection to the Exchange server, as specified in the cfexchangeconnection tag. If you omit this attribute, you must create a temporary connection by specifying cfexchangeconnection tag connection attributes in the cfexchangecalendar tag. (optional)
connection.name: connection

event.help: A reference to the structure that contains the event properties to be set or changed and their values. You must specify this attribute in number signs (#). (required)
event.name: event

generateUniquefilenames.help: A Boolean value specifying whether to generate unique file names if multiple attachments have the same file names. Case "yes": 3x myfile.txt -> myfile.txt, myfile1.txt, and myfile2.txt. (optional, default=no)
generateUniquefilenames.name: generateUniquefilenames

message.help: The text of an optional message to send in the response or deletion notification. (optional)
message.name: message

name.help: The name of the ColdFusion query variable that will contain the retrieved events or information about the attachments that were retrieved. (required)
name.name: name

notify.help: Boolean value specifying whether to notify others of the changes made to the event (optional)
notify.name: notify

responseType.help: (respond) Must be one of the following: accept, decline, tentative (required)
responseType.name: responseType

result.help: The name of a variable that will contain the UID of the event that is created. You use the UID value in the uid attribute other actions to identify the event to be acted on. (optional)
result.name: result

uid.help: Case-sensitive Exchange UID value or values that uniquely identify the event or events on which to perform the action. For the delete action, this attribute can be a comma delimited list of UID values. The getAttachments, modify, and respond actions allow only a single UID value. (required)
uid.name: uid

attendees.help: This attribute is required with the "getuseravailability" action. This can take a comma separated list of email addresses whose availability needs to be found
attendees.name: attendees

dataRequestType.help: This is used to specify the format of result. If only freee/busy schedule is required, then the datarequetstype can be specified as "FreeBusy". If only time suggestions are expected in the result, the the datarequesttype can be "Suggestion". If both free/busy schedule and suggestions are required, the datarequesttype can be specified as freebusyandsuggestions
dataRequestType.name: dataRequestType

emailaddress.help: Defines the Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP) address of a mailbox user
emailaddress.name: emailaddress

getoccurrence.help: If true, gets all occurances of calendar events, including recurring events. Default is false. StartDate and EndDate are required when you specify this sttribute. 		 The default behavior does not get recurring events that were scheduled before start date, but where some recurring instances fall in the date range.
getoccurrence.name: getoccurrence

cfexchangecalendar.help: Creates, deletes, modifies, gets, and responds to Microsoft Exchange calendar events, and gets calendar event attachments.
cfexchangecalendar.name: cfexchangecalendar

action.help: The action to take. Must be open or close. (required)
action.name: action

connection.help: The name of the connection. You specify this ID when you close the connection and in tags such as cfexchangemail. (required)
connection.name: connection

mailboxName.help: The ID of the Exchange mailbox to use. Specify this attribute to access a mailbox whose owner has delegated access rights to the account specified in the username attribute. (optional)
mailboxName.name: mailboxName

password.help: (open) The users password for accessing the Exchange server. (optional)
password.name: password

port.help: The port on the server connect to, most commonly port 80. (optional)
port.name: port

protocol.help: The protocol to use for the connection. Valid values are http and https. (optional)
protocol.name: protocol

proxyHost.help: The URL or IP address of the proxy host required for access to the network. (optional)
proxyHost.name: proxyHost

proxyPort.help: The port on the proxy server to connect to, most commonly port 80. (optional)
proxyPort.name: proxyPort

server.help: The IP address or URL of the server that is providing access to Exchange. (required)
server.name: server

username.help: The Exchange user ID (required)
username.name: username

folder.help: The forward slash (/) delimited path from the root of the mailbox to the folder for which to get subfolders.
folder.name: folder

recurse.help: *  true: get information on the immediate subfolders of the specified folder only. * false: get information on all levels of subfolders of the specified folder.
recurse.name: recurse

name.help: The name of the ColdFusion query variable that contains information about the subfolders.
name.name: name

exchangeServerLanguage.help: The language of the Exchange server. Default is English.
exchangeServerLanguage.name: exchangeServerLanguage

formBasedAuthentication.help: A Boolean value that specifies whether to display a login form and use form based authentication when making the connection.
formBasedAuthentication.name: formBasedAuthentication

serverversion.help: Version of Microsoft Exchange Server. This attribute decides whether the coldfusion should use EWS/WebDAV for communicating to the exchange server
serverversion.name: serverversion

cfexchangeconnection.help: Opens or closes a persistent connection to an Microsoft Exchange server. You must have a persistent or temporary connection to use the cfexchangecalendar, cfexchangecontact, cfexchangemail, and cfexchangetask tags to get or change information on the Exchange server.
cfexchangeconnection.name: cfexchangeconnection

action.help: The action to take. Must be one of the following: create, delete, get, getAttachments, modify (required)
action.name: action

attachmentPath.help: The absolute file path of the directory in which to put the attachments. If the directory does not exist, ColdFusion creates it. If you omit this attribute, ColdFusion does not save any attachments. (optional)
attachmentPath.name: attachmentPath

connection.help: The name of the connection to the Exchange server, as specified in the cfexchangeconnection tag. If you omit this attribute, you must create a temporary connection by specifying cfexchangeconnection tag connection attributes in the cfexchangecontact tag. (optional)
connection.name: connection

contact.help: A reference to the structure that contains the contact properties to be set or changed and their values. You must specify this attribute in number signs (#). For more information on the event structure, see the Usage section. (required)
contact.name: contact

generateUniqueFilenames.help: A Boolean value specifying whether to generate unique file names if multiple attachments have the same file names. Case "yes": 3x myfile.txt -> myfile.txt, myfile1.txt, and myfile2.txt. (optional, default=no)
generateUniqueFilenames.name: generateUniqueFilenames

name.help: The name of the ColdFusion query variable that will contain the retrieved events or information about the attachments that were retrieved. (required)
name.name: name

result.help: The name of a variable that will contain the UID of the contact that is created. You use this value in the uid attribute other actions to identify the contact to be acted on. (optional)
result.name: result

uid.help: A case-sensitive Exchange UID value that uniquely identifies the contacts on which to perform the action. For the delete action, this attribute can be a comma delimited list of UID values. The getAttachments and modify action allow only a single UID value. (required)
uid.name: uid

cfexchangecontact.help: Creates, deletes, modifies, and gets Microsoft Exchange contact records, and gets contact record attachments.
cfexchangecontact.name: cfexchangecontact

name.help: The type of filter to use. (required)
name.name: name

from.help: The start date or or date/time combination of the range to use for filtering. Cannot be used with the value attribute. If you specify a from attribute without a to attribute, the filter selects for all entries on or after the specified date or time. The value can be in any date/time format recognized by ColdFusion, but must correspond to a value that is appropriate for the filter type. (optional)
from.name: from

to.help: The end date or date/time combination for the range used for filtering. Cannot be used with the value attribute. If you specify a to attribute without a from attribute, the filter selects for all entries on or before the specified date or time. The value can be in any date/time format recognized by ColdFusion, but must correspond to a value that is appropriate for the filter type. (optional)
to.name: to

value.help: The filter value for all filters that do not take a date or time range. Cannot be used with the from and to attributes. If the name attribute requires this attribute, ColdFusion generates an error if it has an empty or null value. (optional)
value.name: value

cfexchangefilter (name).help: Specifies the filter parameter for cfexchangemail, cfexchangecalendar, cfexchangetask, and cfexchangecontact, get operations.
cfexchangefilter (name).name: cfexchangefilter

name.help: The type of filter to use. (required)
name.name: name

from.help: The start date or or date/time combination of the range to use for filtering. Cannot be used with the value attribute. If you specify a from attribute without a to attribute, the filter selects for all entries on or after the specified date or time. The value can be in any date/time format recognized by ColdFusion, but must correspond to a value that is appropriate for the filter type. (optional)
from.name: from

to.help: The end date or date/time combination for the range used for filtering. Cannot be used with the value attribute. If you specify a to attribute without a from attribute, the filter selects for all entries on or before the specified date or time. The value can be in any date/time format recognized by ColdFusion, but must correspond to a value that is appropriate for the filter type. (optional)
to.name: to

value.help: The filter value for all filters that do not take a date or time range. Cannot be used with the from and to attributes. If the name attribute requires this attribute, ColdFusion generates an error if it has an empty or null value. (optional)
value.name: value

cfexchangefilter.help: Specifies the filter parameter for cfexchangemail, cfexchangecalendar, cfexchangetask, and cfexchangecontact, get operations.
cfexchangefilter.name: cfexchangefilter

action.help: The name to use for the JavaScript proxy class. (required)
action.name: action

attachmentPath.help: The file path of the directory in which to put the attachments. If the directory does not exist, ColdFusion creates it. If you omit this attribute, ColdFusion does not save any attachments. If you specify a relative path, the path root is the ColdFusion temporary directory, which is returned by the GetTempDirectory function. (optional)
attachmentPath.name: attachmentPath

connection.help: The name of the connection to the Exchange server, as specified in the cfexchangeconnection tag. If you omit this attribute, and you specify cfexchangeconnection tag attributes in this tag, Coldfusion creates a temporary connection. (optional)
connection.name: connection

folder.help: The forward slash (/) delimited path, relative to the inbox, of the folder that contains the message or messages. The cfechangemail tag looks in the specified folder only, and does not search subfolders. If you omit this attribute, Exchange looks in the top level of the inbox. (optional)
folder.name: folder

generateUniqueFilenames.help: A Boolean value specifying whether to generate unique file names if multiple attachments have the same file names. Case "yes": 3x myfile.txt -> myfile.txt, myfile1.txt, and myfile2.txt. (optional, default=no)
generateUniqueFilenames.name: generateUniqueFilenames

mailUID.help: The case-sensitive UID of the mail message that contains the meeting request, response, or cancellation notfication. You can use this attribute if there are multiple messages about a single meeting. (optional)
mailUID.name: mailUID

meetingUID.help: The case-sensitive UID of the meeting for which you received the notification. (required)
meetingUID.name: meetingUID

message.help: A reference to a structure that contains the properties to be set and their values. You must specify this attribute in number signs (#). (required)
message.name: message

name.help: The name of the ColdFusion query variable that will contain the returned mail messages or information about the attachments that were retrieved. (required)
name.name: name

UID.help: The case-sensitive UIDs of the messages on which to perform the action. For the delete action, this attribute can be a comma delimited list of UID values. The getAttachments and set actions allow only a single UID value. (required)
UID.name: UID

destinationfolder.help: The forward slash (/) delimited path, relative to the root of the mailbox, of the folder to which to move the message or messages.
destinationfolder.name: destinationfolder

cfexchangemail.help: Gets mail messages and attachments, deletes messages, and sets properties for messages on a Microsoft Exchange server. The cfexchangemail tag performs mail actions on an Exchange server that you cannot do using the cfmail tag.
cfexchangemail.name: cfexchangemail

action.help: The action to take. Must be one of the following: create, delete, get, getAttachments, modify (optional)
action.name: action

attachmentPath.help: The file path of the directory in which to put the attachments. If the directory does not exist, ColdFusion creates it. If you omit this attribute, ColdFusion does not save any attachments. If you specify a relative path, the path root is the ColdFusion temporary directory, which is returned by the GetTempDirectory function. (optional)
attachmentPath.name: attachmentPath

connection.help: The name of the connection to the Exchange server, as specified in the cfexchangeconnection tag. If you omit this attribute, and you specify cfexchangeconnection tag attributes in this tag, Coldfusion creates a temporary connection. (optional)
connection.name: connection

task.help: A reference to the structure that contains the task properties to be set or changed and their values. You must specify this attribute in number signs (#). For more information on the event structure, see the Usage section. (required)
task.name: task

name.help: The name of the ColdFusion query variable that will contain the returned mail messages or information about the attachments that were retrieved. (required)
name.name: name

result.help: (create) The name of a variable that will contain the UID of the task that is created. You use this value in the uid attribute of other actions to identify the task to be acted on. (optional)
result.name: result

uid.help: A case-sensitive Exchange UID value that uniquely identifies the tasks on which to perform the action. For the delete action, this attribute can be a comma delimited list of UID values. The getAttachments and modify action allow only a single UID value. (optional)
uid.name: uid

cfexchangetask.help: Creates, deletes, modifies, and gets Microsoft Exchange tasks, and gets task attachments.
cfexchangetask.name: cfexchangetask

action.help: The action to take. Must be one of the following: getInfo, getExtendedlnfo, findSubFolders, create, copy, delete, move, modify, empty
action.name: action

name.help: The name of the ColdFusion query variable that contains the returned information about the folder
name.name: name

folderID.help: UID that is used to identify the folder in which the actions are performed. This attriute 		is not required for getExtendedInfor and getInfo, if folderpath is specified
folderID.name: folderID

folderPath.help: Full path to the folder where the action has to be performed
folderPath.name: folderPath

pathDelimiter.help: Lets you specify the delimiter that is used to separate the folders
pathDelimiter.name: pathDelimiter

parentFolderId.help: UID that is used to identify the folder in which you create subfolders
parentFolderId.name: parentFolderId

connection.help: The name of the connection to the Exchange server, as specified in the cfexchangeconnection tag. 	If you omit this attribute, and you specify cfexchangeconnection tag attributes in this tag, 	Coldfusion creates a temporary connection. (optional)
connection.name: connection

result.help: A query variable that contains the result returned from the exchange server when one of the action is performed
result.name: result

destinationFolderID.help: A case-sensitive Exchange UID value that uniquely identifies the destination folder
destinationFolderID.name: destinationFolderID

sourceFolderID.help: The UID that is used to identify the folder from which you copy or move folders to the destination folder
sourceFolderID.name: sourceFolderID

deleteType.help: hardDelete: Removes a folder permanently from the Exchange server, softDelete: Moves a folder to the dumpster in Exchange server, if dumpster is enabled., moveToDeletedItems: Moves a folder to the deleted items folder
deleteType.name: deleteType

folder.help: A struct that contains the required information of the folder that has to be created or modified, such as display name and folder class
folder.name: folder

uid.help: UID that is used to identify the folder in which the actions are performed.
uid.name: uid

password.help: No Help Available
password.name: password

username.help: No Help Available
username.name: username

cfexchangefolder.help: Manage folders in the Exchange Server 		]]>
cfexchangefolder.name: cfexchangefolder

action.help: The action to take. Must be one of the following: get, setReadState, copy, move, delete
action.name: action

name.help: The name of the ColdFusion query variable that contains the returned conversation information
name.name: name

folderID.help: A case-sensitive Exchange UID value that uniquely identifies the folder
folderID.name: folderID

uid.help: The ID of the conversation on which the action has to be taken
uid.name: uid

isRead.help: Indicates the status of the conversation, if read or not
isRead.name: isRead

destinationFolderID.help: A case-sensitive Exchange UID value that uniquely identifies the destination folder
destinationFolderID.name: destinationFolderID

connection.help: The name of the connection to the Exchange server, as specified in the cfexchangeconnection tag. 	If you omit this attribute, and you specify cfexchangeconnection tag attributes in this tag, 	Coldfusion creates a temporary connection. (optional)
connection.name: connection

deleteType.help: hardDelete: Removes a folder permanently from the Exchange server, softDelete: Moves a folder to the dumpster in Exchange server, if dumpster is enabled., moveToDeletedItems: Moves a folder to the deleted items folder
deleteType.name: deleteType

password.help: No Help Available
password.name: password

username.help: No Help Available
username.name: username

action.help: The name to use for the JavaScript proxy class. The action to take, one of the following values: "create" Creates an RSS 2.0 or Atom 1.0 feed XML document and saves it in a variable, writes it to a file, or both. "read" Parses an RSS or Atom feed from a URL or an XML file and saves it in a structure or query. You can also get query metadata in a separate structure. (optional, default= read)
action.name: action

columnMap.help: Used only for the create action with a query attribute. A structure specifying a mapping between the names of the columns in the object specified by the query attribute and the columns of the ColdFusion feed format, as described in the Query attribute section. The key for each field must be a column name listed in the Query columns section. The value of the field must be the name of the corresponding column in the query object used as input to the create action. (optional)
columnMap.name: columnMap

enclosureDir.help: Used only for the read action. Path to the directory in which to save any enclosures that are available in the feed being read. The path can be absolute or relative to the CFML file. If the directory does not exist, ColdFusion generates an error. If you omit this attribute, ColdFusion does not save enclosures. To specify the directory that contains the current page, set this attribute to .(period). (optional)
enclosureDir.name: enclosureDir

ignoreEnclosureError.help: If this attribute is true, ColdFusion attempts to save all enclosures. If it encounters an error downloading one enclosure, it continues downloading other enclosures and writes the error information in the server log. If this attribute is false, ColdFusion stops downloading all enclosures and generates an error when it encounters an error downloading an enclosure. Note: Enclosure errors can occur if the specified enclosure is of a type that the web server does not allow to be downloaded. (optional, default=false)
ignoreEnclosureError.name: ignoreEnclosureError

name.help: A structure that contains complete feed data: The output of a read action. The input definition of the feed to create. This structure contains complete feed information. When you specify the name attribute for a create action, you must put it in pound signs (#). (optional)
name.name: name

outputFile.help: Path of the file in which to write the feed as XML text. The path can be absolute, or relative to the CFML file. (optional)
outputFile.name: outputFile

overwrite.help: Whether to overwrite the XML feed file if it already exists. If you do not set this attribute to true and the cffeed tag tries to write to a file that exists, ColdFusion generates an error. (optional, default=false)
overwrite.name: overwrite

overwriteEnclosure.help: Used only for the read action. Whether to overwrite files in the enclosure directory if they already exist. If you do not set this attribute to true and the cffeed tag tries to write to a file that exists, ColdFusion generates an error. (optional, default=false)
overwriteEnclosure.name: overwriteEnclosure

properties.help: A structure containing the feed metadata, the information about the entire feed. Can contain either of the following: The output of a read action. Input to a create action. The properties and query attributes combined provide complete feed information. When you specify the properties attribute for a create action, you must put it in pound signs (#) (optional)
properties.name: properties

query.help: A query object containing the Atom entries or RSS items in the feed. Can contain either of the following: The output of a read action. Input to a create action. The properties and query attributes combined provide complete feed information. When you specify the query attribute for a create action, you must put it in pound signs (#) (optional)
query.name: query

source.help: Used only for the read action. The URL of the feed or the path to the XML file that contains the feed contents. A path can be absolute, or relative to the CFML file. (required)
source.name: source

timeout.help: The number of seconds to wait for a response from the feed source. A value of 0 specifies that the request does not time out.
timeout.name: timeout

proxyServer.help: Host name or IP address of a proxy server to which to send the request.
proxyServer.name: proxyServer

xmlvar.help: A variable in which to save the read or created feed as XML text.
xmlvar.name: xmlvar

proxyPort.help: The port to connect to on the proxy server.
proxyPort.name: proxyPort

proxyPassword.help: Password required by the proxy server.
proxyPassword.name: proxyPassword

userAgent.help: Text to put in the HTTP User-Agent request header field. Used to identify the request client software.
userAgent.name: userAgent

proxyUser.help: User name to provide to the proxy server.
proxyUser.name: proxyUser

escapeChars.help: Escapes invalid utf8 chars when set to true
escapeChars.name: escapeChars

cffeed.help: Reads or creates an RSS or Atom syndication feed. This tag can read RSS versions 0.90, 0.91, 0.92, 0.93, 0.94, 1.0, and 2.0, and Atom 0.3 or 1.0. It can create RSS 2.0 or Atom 1.0 feeds.
cffeed.name: cffeed

action.help: The action to take. Must be one of the following: border captcha convert info read resize rotate write writeToBrowser You do not need to specify the default action, read, explicitly. (optional, default=read)
action.name: action

angle.help: Angle in degrees to rotate the image. You must specify an integer for the value. (required)
angle.name: angle

color.help: (border) Border color. Hexadecimal value or supported named color. For a hexadecimal value, use the form "##xxxxxx" or "xxxxxx". (required)
color.name: color

destination.help: Absolute or relative pathname where the image output is written. The image format is determined by the file extension. The convert and write actions require a destination. The border, captcha, resize, and rotate actions require either a name attribute or a destination attribute. You can specify both. Scorpio supports only CAPTCHA images in PNG format. If you do not enter a destination, the CAPTCHA image is placed inline in the HTML output and displayed in the web browser. (optional)
destination.name: destination

difficulty.help: Level of complexity of the CAPTCHA text. Specify one of the following levels of text distortion: high medium low (optional, default=low)
difficulty.name: difficulty

fontSize.help: Font size of the text in the CAPTCHA image. The value must be an integer. (optional)
fontSize.name: fontSize

format.help: Format of the image displayed in the browser. If you do not specify a format, the image is displayed in PNG format. You cannot display a GIF image in a browser. GIF images are displayed in PNG format. (optional, Default=PNG)
format.name: format

height.help: Height in pixels of the image. For the resize attribute, you also can specify the height as a percentage (an integer followed by the "%" symbol). The value must be an integer. (optional)
height.name: height

isBase64.help: Specifies whether the source is a Base64 string. The isBase64 values are: yes: the source is a Base64 string. no: the source is not a Base64 string. (optional, default=no)
isBase64.name: isBase64

name.help: Name of the ColdFusion image variable.
name.name: name

overwrite.help: Valid only if the destination attribute is specified. The overwrite values are: yes: overwrites the destination file. no: does not overwrite the destination file. If the destination file already exists, ColdFusion generates an error if the overwrite option is not set to yes. (optional, default=no)
overwrite.name: overwrite

quality.help: Quality of the JPEG destination file. Applies only to files with an extension of JPG or JPEG. Valid values are fractions that range from 0 through 1 (the lower the number, the lower the quality). (optional, default=0.75)
quality.name: quality

source.help: URL of the source image; for example, "http://www.google.com/ images/logo.gif" Absolute or relative pathname of the source image; for example, "c:\wwwroot\images\logo.jpg" ColdFusion image variable containing another image, BLOB, or byte array; for example, "#myImage#" Base64 string; for example, "data:image/jpg;base64,/9j/ 4AAQSkZJRgABAQA.............." (required)
source.name: source

structName.help: () Name of the ColdFusion structure to be created. (required)
structName.name: structName

text.help: Text string displayed in the CAPTCHA image. Use capital letters for better readability. (required)
text.name: text

thickness.help: Border thickness in pixels. The border is added to the outside edge of the source image, increasing the image area accordingly. The value must be an integer. (optional, default=1)
thickness.name: thickness

width.help: Width in pixels of the image. For resize, you also can specify the width as a percentage (an integer followed by the "%" symbol). The value must be an integer. (required)
width.name: width

fonts.help: One or more valid fonts to use for the CAPTCHA text. Separate multiple fonts with commas. ColdFusion supports only the system fonts that the JDK can recognize.
fonts.name: fonts

interpolation.help: Indicates algorithm to use when resizing the image. The default is highestQuality.
interpolation.name: interpolation

cfimage.help: Creates a ColdFusion image that can be manipulated by using Image functions. You can use the cfimage tag to perform common image manipulation operations as a shortcut to Image functions. You can use the cfimage tag independently or in conjunction with Image functions.
cfimage.name: cfimage

displayName.help: A value to be displayed when using introspection to show a descriptive name for the interface. (optional)
displayName.name: displayName

extends.help: A comma delimited list of one or more interfaces that this interface extends. Any CFC that implements an interface must also implement all the functions in the interfaces specified by this property. If an interface extends another interface, and the child interface specifies a function with the same name as one in the parent interface, both functions must have the same attribues; otherwise ColdFusion generates an error. (optional)
extends.name: extends

hint.help: Text to be displayed when using introspection to show information about the interface. The hint attribute value follows the syntax line in the function description. (optional)
hint.name: hint

cfinterface.help: Defines an interface that consists of a set of signatures for functions. The interface does not include the full function definitions; instead, you implement the functions in a CFC. The interfaces that you define by using this tag can make up the structure of a reusable application framework.
cfinterface.name: cfinterface

action.help: The action to take. Must be one of the following: addwatermark deletepages getinfo merge protect read removewatermark setinfo write (required)
action.name: action

ascending.help: Order in which the PDF files are sorted: yes: files are sorted in ascending order no: files are sorted in descending order (optional, default=no)
ascending.name: ascending

copyfrom.help: The filename of the PDF document from which to copy the watermark (optional)
copyfrom.name: copyfrom

destination.help: The pathname of the modified PDF document. If the destination file exists, you must set the overwrite attribute to yes. If the destination file does not exist, ColdFusion creates it as long as the parent directory exists. (optional)
destination.name: destination

directory.help: Specify the directory of the PDF documents to merge. You must specify either the directory or the source. If you specify the directory, you must also specify the order. (optional)
directory.name: directory

encrypt.help: Specify the type of encryption used on the source PDF document: RC4_40, RC4_128M, AES_128, none (optional)
encrypt.name: encrypt

flatten.help: Specify whether the output file is flattened: yes: the formatting is removed and the file is flattened no: the format of the source PDF is maintained in the output file. (optional,default=no)
flatten.name: flatten

foreground.help: Specify whether the watermark is placed in the foreground of the PDF document: yes: the watermark appears in the foreground no: the watermark appears in the background (optional, default=no)
foreground.name: foreground

image.help: Specify the image used as a watermark. You can specify a filename or a ColdFusion image variable. (optional)
image.name: image

info.help: Specify the structure variable for relevant information, for example, #infoStruct#. ColdFusion ignores read only information, such as the creation date, application used to create the PDF document, and encryption parameters. (required)
info.name: info

isBase64.help: Specify whether the image used a watermark is in Base64 format: yes: the image is in Base64 format no: the image is not in Base64 format (optional, default=no)
isBase64.name: isBase64

keepbookmark.help: Specify whether bookmarks from the source PDF documents are retained in the merged document: yes: the bookmarks are retained no: the bookmarks are removed (optional, default=no)
keepbookmark.name: keepbookmark

name.help: Specify the PDF document variable name, for example, myPDFdoc. If the source is a PDF document variable, you cannot specify the name attribute again; you can write the modified PDF document to the destination. You can specify the destination attribute or 			the name attribute, but not both. For the processddx action, 			the name represents the structure that is populated 			with the success or failure of the output variables. 			For the readsignaturefields action, the name represents the structure 			thats is populated with the info of all the signature 			fields in the source PDF document. 			For the validatesignature option, the name attribute contains a Boolean field 			denoting the signature validity and an array containing 			the names of all the invalid signatures. (optional)
name.name: name

newOwnerPassword.help: Specify the password for the owner of the PDF document. (optional)
newOwnerPassword.name: newOwnerPassword

newUserPassword.help: Specify the password for the user of the PDF document. (optional)
newUserPassword.name: newUserPassword

opacity.help: Specify the opacity of the watermark. Valid values are integers in the range 0 (transparent) through 10 (opaque). (optional, default=3)
opacity.name: opacity

order.help: Specify the order in which the PDF documents in the directory are merged: name: orders the documents alphabetically time: orders the documents by timestamp (required)
order.name: order

overwrite.help: Specify whether to overwrite the destination file: yes: overwrites the destination file no: does not overwrite the destination file (optional)
overwrite.name: overwrite

password.help: Specify the owner or user password of the source PDF document, if it exists. (optional)
password.name: password

permissions.help: Specify the type of permissions on the PDF document: AllowPrintHigh AllowPrintLow AllowModify AllowCopy AllowAdd AllowSecure AllowModifyAnnotations AllowExtract AllowFillIn all none Except for all or none, you can specify a commaseparated list of permissions. (optional)
permissions.name: permissions

position.help: Specify the position on the page    where the watermark is placed. The position represents the top-left corner of the watermark. Specify the x and y coordinates; for example 50,30. (optional)
position.name: position

rotation.help: Specify the degree of rotation of the watermark image on the page; for example, 30. (optional)
rotation.name: rotation

showonprint.help: Specify whether the watermark is printed with the PDF document: yes: the watermark is printed with the PDF document no: the watermark is not printed with the PDF document (optional)
showonprint.name: showonprint

source.help: Specify the source. The source can be: The pathname to a PDF document; for example, c:\work\myPDF.pdf A PDF document variable in memory that is generated by the cfdocument tag or the cfpdf tag; for example, #myPDFdoc# The binary content of PDF document variable. (required)
source.name: source

type.help: Specify the type to remove from the source PDF document: attachment bookmark watermark (optional)
type.name: type

version.help: (write) Specify the version of the PDF document to write. Valid values are: 1.1 1.2  1.3 1.4 1.5 1.6 (optional)
version.name: version

transparent.help: Specifies whether the image background is transparent or opaque: foormat=png only * yes: the background is transparent. * no: the background is opaque.
transparent.name: transparent

resolution.help: Image quality used to generate thumbnail images: * high: use high resolution (uses more memory). * low: use low resolution.
resolution.name: resolution

stoponerror.help: Valid only if the directory attribute is specified. If the specified directory contains files other then ColdFusion-readable PDF files, ColdFusion either stops merge process or continues. * yes: stops the merge process if invalid PDF files exist in the specified directory. * no: continues the merge process even if invalid files exist in the specified directory.
stoponerror.name: stoponerror

inputfiles.help: Structure that maps the PDF source files to the input variables in the DDX file, or a string of elements and their pathname.
inputfiles.name: inputfiles

scale.help: Size of the thumbnail relative to the source page. The value represents a percentage from 1 through 100.
scale.name: scale

imageprefix.help: Prefix used for each image thumbnail file generated. The image filenames use the format: imagePrefix_page_n.format.
imageprefix.name: imageprefix

outputfiles.help: Structure that contains the output files in the DDX file or string as keys and the pathname to the result file as the value.
outputfiles.name: outputfiles

pages.help: Page or pages in the source PDF document on which to perform the action. You can specify multiple pages and page ranges as follows: "1,6-9,56-89,100, 110-120".
pages.name: pages

ddxfile.help: Owner or user password of the source PDF document, if the document is password-protected.
ddxfile.name: ddxfile

saveoption.help: Save options for the PDF output: * full: normal save (default) * incremental: required to save modifications to a signed PDF document. * linear: for faster display.
saveoption.name: saveoption

format.help: File type of thumbnail image output: * jpg * tiff * png
format.name: format

hires.help: Sets a high resolution for the thumbnail if set to yes.
hires.name: hires

maxScale.help: Specifies the maximum scale of the thumbnail
maxScale.name: maxScale

maxBreadth.help: Specifies maximum width of the thumbnail
maxBreadth.name: maxBreadth

maxLength.help: Specifies the maximum length of the thumbnail
maxLength.name: maxLength

compressTIFFs.help: Compress thumbnail which are in TIFF format.
compressTIFFs.name: compressTIFFs

overridepage.help: Specify whether to override page or not
overridepage.name: overridepage

hScale.help: Horizontal scale of the image to be modified. Valid values are hscale
hScale.name: hScale

vScale.help: Vertical scale of the image to be modified. Valid values are vsacle
vScale.name: vScale

noAttachments.help: Removes all attachments from PDF documents.
noAttachments.name: noAttachments

noJavaScripts.help: Remove all document level JavaScript actions
noJavaScripts.name: noJavaScripts

algo.help: Specifies the algorithm for image downsampling.
algo.name: algo

leftMargin.help: Specifies the value of the leftMargin
leftMargin.name: leftMargin

rightMargin.help: Specifies the value of the rightMargin
rightMargin.name: rightMargin

bottomMargin.help: Specifies the value of the bottomMargin
bottomMargin.name: bottomMargin

numberFormat.help: Specify the numbering format for PDF pages in the footer.
numberFormat.name: numberFormat

align.help: Aligns the header and footer in PDF.
align.name: align

honourspaces.help: Set this option to "true" if you need characters to be converted to spaces.
honourspaces.name: honourspaces

addQuads.help: Add the position or quadrants of the thumbnail
addQuads.name: addQuads

useStructure.help: Specify whether to use structure or not
useStructure.name: useStructure

encodeAll.help: Encode streams that are not encoded to optimize page content
encodeAll.name: encodeAll

charset.help: Charset to be used when extracting text from the PDF
charset.name: charset

keyalias.help: Alias of the private key in the keystore
keyalias.name: keyalias

signaturefieldname.help: Sign (or unsign) that particular field if signature field exists in the document
signaturefieldname.name: signaturefieldname

keypassword.help: The password corresponding to the given key alias
keypassword.name: keypassword

unsignall.help: Unsigns all the signature in the given document
unsignall.name: unsignall

height.help: Height of the signature field.
height.name: height

width.help: Width of the signature field.
width.name: width

cfpdf.help: Manipulates existing PDF documents. The following list describes some of the tasks you can perform with the cfpdf tag: Merge several PDF documents into one PDF document. Extract pages from multiple PDF documents and generate a new PDF document. Linearize multipage PDF documents for faster display. Encrypt or decrypt PDF files for security.
cfpdf.name: cfpdf

action.help: The action to perform on the source: populate read (required)
action.name: action

datafile.help: (populate read) Pathname for the XML data file. if action="populate", the data from this file populates the fields of the PDF form. if action="read", ColdFusion writes the data to this file. You can specify a pathname relative to the context root or a relative pathname. You must specify either the datafile attribute or the result attribute for the read action; you can specify both. (optional)
datafile.name: datafile

destination.help: (populate) Pathname for the output file. You can specify an absolute pathname or a pathname relative to the context root. The file extension must be PDF or XDP. The file extension determines the format of the file. (The XDP format applies only to LiveCycle forms.) If you do not specify the destination, ColdFusion displays the form in the browser.
