Do not specify the destination when you embed a form in a PDF document. (optional)
destination.name: destination

overwrite.help: (populate, read) Overwrite the destination file (if action="populate) or the data file (if action="read"): yes no (optional)
overwrite.name: overwrite

overwritedata.help: Specifies whether to overwrite existing data in PDF form fields with data from the data source:  * yes: Overwrite existing data in the form fields with that from the data source. * no: Retain existing data in form fields and populate only those fields without data.
overwritedata.name: overwritedata

result.help: (read) ColdFusion structure that contains the form field values. You must specify the datafile attribute or the result attribute; you can specify both. (optional)
result.name: result

source.help: (populate, read) Pathname of the source PDF (absolute path or path relative to the context root) or byte array representing a PDF. (required)
source.name: source

xmldata.help: Pathname for the XML data file.  * If action="populate", the data from this file, XML object, or XML string populates the form fields. You can specify a pathname relative to the context root or a relative pathname. * If action="read", ColdFusion writes the data to the variable.
xmldata.name: xmldata

name.help: Specify the PDF document variable name, for example, myPDFdoc. If the source is a PDF document variable, you cannot specify the name attribute again; you can write the modified PDF document to the destination. (optional)
name.name: name

fdf.help: If set to true, the system creates FDF with subforms and params instead of an XML
fdf.name: fdf

fdfData.help: For populate, you specify the file name from where the FDF data will be imported. For read, you specify the file name where the FDF data will be exported.
fdfData.name: fdfData

cfpdfform.help: Manipulates existing Adobe Acrobat forms and Adobe LiveCycle forms. The following list describes some of the tasks you can perform with the cfpdfform tag: Embed an interactive Acrobat form or LiveCycle form within a PDF document. You use the cfpdfform tag to embed the PDF form within a cfdocument tag. Render an existing Acrobat form or LiveCycle form. This includes prefilling fields from a database or an XML data file and processing form data submitted via HTTP post or PDF format. Extract or prefill values in stored PDF forms and save the output to a file or use it to update a data source.
cfpdfform.name: cfpdfform

index.help: Specify the index associated with the field name. If multiple fields have the same name, the index value is used to locate one of them. (optional, default=1)
index.name: index

name.help: The field name on the PDF form. (requiredl)
name.name: name

value.help: The value associated with the field name. For interactive fields, specify a ColdFusion variable. (optional)
value.name: value

imagefield.help: Indicates if the parameter is an image
imagefield.name: imagefield

cfpdfformparam (name).help: Provides additional information to the cfpdfform tag. The cfpdfformparam tag is always a child tag of the cfpdfform or cfpdfsubform tag. Use the cfpdfformparam tag to populate fields in a PDF form.
cfpdfformparam (name).name: cfpdfformparam

index.help: Specify the index associated with the field name. If multiple fields have the same name, the index value is used to locate one of them. (optional, default=1)
index.name: index

name.help: The field name on the PDF form. (requiredl)
name.name: name

value.help: The value associated with the field name. For interactive fields, specify a ColdFusion variable. (optional)
value.name: value

imagefield.help: Indicates if the parameter is an image
imagefield.name: imagefield

cfpdfformparam (value).help: Provides additional information to the cfpdfform tag. The cfpdfformparam tag is always a child tag of the cfpdfform or cfpdfsubform tag. Use the cfpdfformparam tag to populate fields in a PDF form.
cfpdfformparam (value).name: cfpdfformparam

index.help: Specify the index associated with the field name. If multiple fields have the same name, the index value is used to locate one of them. (optional, default=1)
index.name: index

name.help: The field name on the PDF form. (requiredl)
name.name: name

value.help: The value associated with the field name. For interactive fields, specify a ColdFusion variable. (optional)
value.name: value

imagefield.help: Indicates if the parameter is an image
imagefield.name: imagefield

cfpdfformparam.help: Provides additional information to the cfpdfform tag. The cfpdfformparam tag is always a child tag of the cfpdfform or cfpdfsubform tag. Use the cfpdfformparam tag to populate fields in a PDF form.
cfpdfformparam.name: cfpdfformparam

password.help: Specify the user or owner password, if the source PDF file is passwordprotected. (optional)
password.name: password

source.help: Specify the source PDF file to merge. (optional)
source.name: source

pages.help: Page or pages of the PDF source file to merge. You can specify a range of pages, for example, "1-5 ", or a comma-separated list of pages, for example, "1-5,9-10,18".
pages.name: pages

cfpdfparam (source).help: Provides additional information for the cfpdf tag. The cfpdfparam tag applies only to the  merge action of the cfpdf tag. The cfpdfparam tag is always a child tag of the cfpdf tag.
cfpdfparam (source).name: cfpdfparam

password.help: Specify the user or owner password, if the source PDF file is passwordprotected. (optional)
password.name: password

source.help: Specify the source PDF file to merge. (optional)
source.name: source

pages.help: Page or pages of the PDF source file to merge. You can specify a range of pages, for example, "1-5 ", or a comma-separated list of pages, for example, "1-5,9-10,18".
pages.name: pages

cfpdfparam.help: Provides additional information for the cfpdf tag. The cfpdfparam tag applies only to the  merge action of the cfpdf tag. The cfpdfparam tag is always a child tag of the cfpdf tag.
cfpdfparam.name: cfpdfparam

index.help: Index associated with the field name. If multiple fields have the same name, ColdFusion uses the index value is to locate one of them. (optional, default=1)
index.name: index

name.help: Name of the subform corresponding to subform name in the PDF form. (required)
name.name: name

cfpdfsubform (name).help: Populates a subform within the cfpdfform tag. The cfpdfsubform tag can be a child tag of the cfpdfform tag or nested in another cfpdfsubform tag.
cfpdfsubform (name).name: cfpdfsubform

index.help: Index associated with the field name. If multiple fields have the same name, ColdFusion uses the index value is to locate one of them. (optional, default=1)
index.name: index

name.help: Name of the subform corresponding to subform name in the PDF form. (required)
name.name: name

cfpdfsubform.help: Populates a subform within the cfpdfform tag. The cfpdfsubform tag can be a child tag of the cfpdfform tag or nested in another cfpdfsubform tag.
cfpdfsubform.name: cfpdfsubform

backgroundColor.help: Specifies the background color of the presentation. The value is hexadecimal: use the form "##xxxxxx" or "##xxxxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two number signs or none. (optional, default=0x727971)
backgroundColor.name: backgroundColor

control.help: Specifies the presentation control: normal brief (optional, default=normal)
control.name: control

controlLocation.help: Specifies the location of the presentation control: right left (optional, default= right)
controlLocation.name: controlLocation

directory.help: Specifies the directory where the presentation is saved. This can be absolute path or a path relative to the CFM page. ColdFusion automatically generates the files necessary to run the presentation, including: index.htm components.swf loadflash.js viewer.swf ColdFusion stores any data files in the presentation, including images, video clips, and SWF files referenced by the cfpresentationslide tags in a subdirectory called data. To run the presentation, open the index.htm file. If you do not specify a directory, the presentation runs in the client browser. (optional)
directory.name: directory

glowColor.help: Specifies the color used for glow effects on the buttons. The value is hexadecimal: use the form "##xxxxxx" or "##xxxxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or AF; use two number signs or none. (optional, default=0x35D334)
glowColor.name: glowColor

initialTab.help: Specifies which tab will be on top when the presentation is displayed. This applies only when the control value is normal: outline search notes (optional, default=outline)
initialTab.name: initialTab

lightColor.help: Specifies the light color used for light-and shadow effects. The value is hexadecimal: use the form "##xxxxxx" or "##xxxxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two number signs or none. (optional, default=0x4E5D60)
lightColor.name: lightColor

overwrite.help: Specifies whether files in the directory are overwritten. Specify this attribute only when the you specify the directory. yes: overwrites files if they are already present no: create new files (optional, default=yes)
overwrite.name: overwrite

primaryColor.help: Specifies the primary color of the presentation. The value is hexadecimal: use the form "##xxxxxx" or "##xxxxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or AF; use two number signs or none. (optional, default=0x6F8488)
primaryColor.name: primaryColor

shadowColor.help: Specifies the shadow color used for light-and shadow effects. The value is hexadecimal: use the form "##xxxxxx" or "##xxxxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two number signs or none. (optional, default=0x000000)
shadowColor.name: shadowColor

showNotes.help: Specifies whether the notes tab is present: yes no (optional, default=no)
showNotes.name: showNotes

showOutline.help: Specifies whether the outline is present: yes no (optional, default=yes)
showOutline.name: showOutline

showSearch.help: Specifies whether the search tab is present: yes no (optional, default=yes)
showSearch.name: showSearch

textColor.help: Specifies the color for all the text in the presentation user interface. (optional, default=0xFFFFFF)
textColor.name: textColor

title.help: Specifies the title of the presentation. (optional)
title.name: title

authpassword.help: Sends a password to the target URL for Basic Authentication. Combined with username to form a base64 encoded string that is passed in the Authenticate header.
authpassword.name: authpassword

authuser.help: Sends a user name to the target URL for Basic Authentication. Combined with password to form a base64 encoded string that is passed in the Authenticate header.
authuser.name: authuser

autoplay.help: Specifies whether to play the presentation automatically: * true: the presentation automatically runs through the entire presentation at startup. * false: the user must click the Play button to start the presentation and click the Next button to advance to the next slide in the presentation.
autoplay.name: autoplay

loop.help: Specifies whether the presentation runs in a loop: * true: the presentation restarts automatically after it ends. * false: the user must click the Play button to restart the presentation.
loop.name: loop

proxypassword.help: Password required by the proxy server.
proxypassword.name: proxypassword

proxyuser.help: User name to provide to the proxy server.
proxyuser.name: proxyuser

proxyhost.help: Host name or IP address of a proxy server to which to send the request.
proxyhost.name: proxyhost

proxyport.help: The port to connect to on the proxy server.
proxyport.name: proxyport

useragent.help: Text to put in the HTTP User-Agent request header field. Used to identify the request client software.
useragent.name: useragent

cfpresentation.help: Defines the look and feel of a dynamic slide presentation. Use the cfpresentation tag as the parent tag for one or more cfpresentationslide tags, where you define the content for the presentation.
cfpresentation.name: cfpresentation

audio.help: Specifies the path of the audio file relative to the CFM page. The audio file must be an MP3 file. A slide cannot have both audio and video specified (optional)
audio.name: audio

bottomMargin.help: Specifies the bottom margin of the slide. (optional, default=0)
bottomMargin.name: bottomMargin

duration.help: Specifies the duration in seconds that the slide is played. (required)
duration.name: duration

notes.help: Specifies the notes used for the slide. (optional)
notes.name: notes

presenter.help: Specifies the presenter of the slide. A slide can have only one presenter. This name must match one of the presenter names in the cfpresenter tag. If no presenter is specified, it will take the first presenter specified in the presenter list. (optional)
presenter.name: presenter

rightMargin.help: Specifies the right margin of the slide. (optional, default=0)
rightMargin.name: rightMargin

scale.help: Specifies the scale used for the HTML content on the slide presentation. If the scale attribute is not specified and the content cannot fit in one slide, it will automatically be scaled down to fit on the slide. (optional, default=1.0)
scale.name: scale

src.help: HTML or SWF source files used as a slide. You can specify the following as the slide source: an absolute path a path relative to the CFM page a URL: you can specify the URL only if the source is an HTML file SWF files must be present on the system running ColdFusion and the path must either be an absolute path or path relative to the CFM page. If the src value is not specified, you must specify HTML/CFML code as the body. If you specify a source file and HTML /CFML, ColdFusion ignores the source file and displays the HTML/CFML in the slide. (optional)
src.name: src

title.help: Specifies the title of the slide. (required)
title.name: title

topMargin.help: Specifies the top margin of the slide. (optional, default=0)
topMargin.name: topMargin

video.help: Specifies the video file used for the presenter of the slide. If you specify video for the slide and an image for the presenter, the video is used instead of the image for the slide. You cannot specify both audio and video for a slide. The video must be an FLV file. (optional)
video.name: video

advance.help: Overrides the cfpresentation tag autoPlay attribute for the slide: * auto: after the slide plays, the presentation advances to the next slide automatically. This is the default value if cfpresentation autoPlay="yes". * never: after the slide plays, the presentation does not advance to the next slide until the user clicks the Next button. This is the default value if cfpresentation autoPlay="no". * click: after the slide plays, the presentation advances to the next slide if the user clicks anywhere in the main presentation area.
advance.name: advance

authpassword.help: Use to pass a password to the target URL for Basic Authentication. Combined with username to form a base64 encoded string that is passed in the Authenticate header.
authpassword.name: authpassword

authuser.help: Use to pass a user name to the target URL for Basic Authentication. Combined with password to form a base64 encoded string that is passed in the Authenticate header.
authuser.name: authuser

useragent.help: Text to put in the HTTP User-Agent request header field. Identifies the request client software.
useragent.name: useragent

slides.help: Used to specify the slide numbers required to export from ppt file
slides.name: slides

useexternalprogram.help: Flag to indicate if external program to be used to open presentation
useexternalprogram.name: useexternalprogram

cfpresentationslide.help: Creates a slide dynamically from an HTML source file, HTML and CFML code, or an SWF source file. If you do not specify a source file, you must include the HMTL or CFML code for the body of the slide within the cfpresentationslide tag. The cfpresentationslide is the child tag of the cfpresentation tag.
cfpresentationslide.name: cfpresentationslide

biography.help: Specifies the biography of the presenter. (required)
biography.name: biography

email.help: The name to use for the JavaScript proxy class. (optional)
email.name: email

image.help: Specifies the path for the presenter's image in JPEG format. The JPG file must be relative to theCFM page. (optional)
image.name: image

name.help: Specifies the name of the presenter. (required)
name.name: name

logo.help: Specifies the path for the presenter's logo or the logo of the presenters organization. The logo must be in JPEG format. The file must be relative to the CFM page. (optional)
logo.name: logo

title.help: Specifies the title of the presenter. (optional)
title.name: title

cfpresenter (name).help: Describes a presenter in a slide presentation. A slide presentation can have multiple presenters. The presenters must be referenced from the slides defined by the cfpresentationslide tag.
cfpresenter (name).name: cfpresenter

biography.help: Specifies the biography of the presenter. (required)
biography.name: biography

email.help: The name to use for the JavaScript proxy class. (optional)
email.name: email

image.help: Specifies the path for the presenter's image in JPEG format. The JPG file must be relative to theCFM page. (optional)
image.name: image

name.help: Specifies the name of the presenter. (required)
name.name: name

logo.help: Specifies the path for the presenter's logo or the logo of the presenters organization. The logo must be in JPEG format. The file must be relative to the CFM page. (optional)
logo.name: logo

title.help: Specifies the title of the presenter. (optional)
title.name: title

cfpresenter.help: Describes a presenter in a slide presentation. A slide presentation can have multiple presenters. The presenters must be referenced from the slides defined by the cfpresentationslide tag.
cfpresenter.name: cfpresenter

action.help: The action to take, one of the following values: join Makes the current thread wait until the thread or threads specified in the name attribute complete processing, or until the period specified in the timeout attribute passes, before continuing processing. If you dont specify a timeout and thread you are joining to doesnt finish, the current thread also cannot finish processing. run Creates a thread and starts it processing. sleep Suspends the current threads processing for the time specified by the duration attribute. This action is useful if one thread must wait for another thread to do processing without joining the threads. terminate Stops processing of the thread specified in the name attribute. If you terminate a thread, the thread scope includes an ERROR metadata structure with information about the termination. (optional, default=run)
action.name: action

duration.help: (sleep) The number of milliseconds for which to suspend thread processing. (required)
duration.name: duration

name.help: The name of the thread to which the action applies: terminate The name of the thread to stop. join The name of the thread or threads to join to the current thread. To specify multiple threads, use a comma-delimited list. run The name to use to identify the thread being created. (required)
name.name: name

priority.help: The priority level at which to run the thread. The following values are valid: HIGH, LOW, NORMAL Higher priority threads get more processing time than lower priority threads. Page-level code, the code that is outside of cfthread tags, always has NORMAL priority. (optional, default=NORMAL)
priority.name: priority

timeout.help: The number of milliseconds that the current thread waits for the thread or threads being joined to finish. If any thread does not finish by the specified time, the current thread proceeds. If the attribute value is 0, the default, the current thread continues waiting until all joining threads finish. If the current thread is the page thread, the page continues waiting until the threads are joined, even if you specify a page timeout. (optional, default=0)
timeout.name: timeout

cfthread.help: The cfthread tag enables multithreaded programming in ColdFusion. Threads are independent streams of execution, and multiple threads on a page can execute simultaneously and asynchronously, letting you perform asynchronous processing in CFML. CFML code within the cfthread tag body executes on a separate thread while the page request thread continues processing without waiting for the cfthread body to finish. You use this tag to run or end a thread, temporarily stop thread execution, or join together multiple threads.
cfthread.name: cfthread

action.help: The action to take. Must be one of the following: delete list read readBinary unzip zip If you do not specify an action, ColdFusion applies the default action, zip. (optional)
action.name: action

charset.help: The character set used to translate the ZIP or JAR entry into a text string. Examples of character sets are: JIS RFC1345 UTF-16 (optional, default=encoding of the host machine)
charset.name: charset

destination.help: Destination directory where the ZIP or JAR file is extracted. (optional)
destination.name: destination

entrypath.help: Pathname on which the action is performed. (optional)
entrypath.name: entrypath

file.help: Absolute pathname of the file on which the action is performed. For example, the full pathname of the ZIP file: c:\temp\log.zip. If you do not specify the full pathname (for example, file="log.zip"), ColdFusion creates the file in a temporary directory. You can use the GetTempDirectory function to access the ZIP or JAR file. (required)
file.name: file

filter.help: File filter applied to the action. The action applies to all files in the pathname specified that match the filter. (optional)
filter.name: filter

name.help: Record set name in which the result of the list action is stored. The record set columns are: name: filename of the entry in the JAR file. For example, if the entry is help/docs/index.htm, the name is index.htm. directory: directory containing the entry. For the example above, the directory is help/docs. You can obtain the full entry name by concatenating directory and name. If an entry is at the root level, the directory is empty (''). size: uncompressed size of the entry, in bytes. compressedSize: compressed size of the entry, in bytes. type: type of entry (directory or file). dateLastModified: last modified date of the entry, cfdate object. comment: any comment, if present, for the entry. crc: crc-32 checksum of the uncompressed entry data. (required)
name.name: name

overwrite.help: unzip: Specifies whether to overwrite the extracted files: yes: if the extracted file already exists at the destination specified, the file is overwritten. no: if the extracted file already exists at the destination specified, the file is not overwritten and that entry is not extracted. The remaining entries are extracted. zip: Specifies whether to overwrite the contents of a ZIP or JAR file: yes: overwrites all of the content in the ZIP or JAR file if it exists. no: updates existing entries and adds new entries to the ZIP or JAR file if it exists. (optional, default=no)
overwrite.name: overwrite

prefix.help: String added as a prefix to the ZIP or JAR entry. The string is the name of a subdirectory in which the entries are added. (optional)
prefix.name: prefix

recurse.help: Specifies whether the action applies to subdirectories: yes: includes subdirectories. no: does not include subdirectories. (optional, default=yes)
recurse.name: recurse

showDirectory.help: yes: lists the directories. no: does not list directories. (optional, default= no)
showDirectory.name: showDirectory

source.help: Source directory to be zipped. Not required if cfzipparam is specified. (required)
source.name: source

storePath.help: zip: Specifies whether pathnames are stored in the ZIP or JAR file: yes: pathnames of entries are stored in the ZIP or JAR file. no: pathnames of the entries are not stored in the ZIP or JAR file. All the files are placed at the root level. In case of a name conflict, the last file in the iteration is added. unzip: Specifies whether files are stored at the entrypath: yes: the files are extracted to the entrypath. no: the entrypath is ignored and all the files are extracted at the root level. (optional, default= yes)
storePath.name: storePath

variable.help: Variable in which the read content is stored. (required)
variable.name: variable

password.help: Password with which to archive the files
password.name: password

encryptionAlgorithm.help: Encryption algorithm to be used to encrypt the files when a password is given
encryptionAlgorithm.name: encryptionAlgorithm

cfzip.help: Manipulates ZIP and JavaTM Archive (JAR) files. In addition to the basic zip and unzip functions, use the cfzip tag to delete entries from an archive, filter files, read files in binary format, list the contents of an archive, and specify an entrypath used in an executable JAR file.
cfzip.name: cfzip

charset.help: Converts string content into binary data before putting it into a ZIP or JAR file. Used only when cfzip action="zip" and the cfzipparam content is a string. Examples of character sets are: JIS RFC1345 UTF-16 (optional, default=encoding of the host machine)
charset.name: charset

content.help: Content written to the ZIP or JAR entry. Used only when cfzip action="zip". Valid content data types are binary and string. If you specify the content attribute, you must specify the entrypath attribute. (optional)
content.name: content

entrypath.help: Pathanme used: For cfzip action="zip", it is the entrypath used. This is valid only when the source is a file. The entrypath creates a subdirectory within the ZIP or JAR file. For cfzip action="unzip", it is the pathname to unzip. For cfzip action="delete", it is the pathname to delete from the ZIP or JAR file. (optional)
entrypath.name: entrypath

filter.help: File filter applied to the action. For example, for the zip action, all the files in the source directory matching the filter are zipped. (optional)
filter.name: filter

prefix.help: String added as a prefix to the ZIP or JAR entry. Used only when cfzip action="zip". (optional)
prefix.name: prefix

recurse.help: Recurse the directory to be zipped, unzipped, or deleted, as specified by the cfzip parent tag. (optional, default=yes)
recurse.name: recurse

source.help: Source directory or file. Used only when cfzip action="zip". Specified file(s) are added to the ZIP or JAR file: If you specify source attribute for the cfzip tag, the cfzipparam source is relative to it. If you do not specify a source attribute for the cfzip tag, the cfzipparam source must be an absolute path. (optional)
source.name: source

password.help: Password with which to archive the files
password.name: password

encryptionAlgorithm.help: Encryption algorithm to be used to encrypt the files when a password is given
encryptionAlgorithm.name: encryptionAlgorithm

cfzipparam.help: Provides additional information to the cfzip tag. The cfzipparam tag is always a child tag of the cfzip tag.
cfzipparam.name: cfzipparam

width.help: Width in pixel. Default='300'
width.name: width

height.help: Height in pixel.
height.name: height

bind.help: A bind expression specifying a client JavaScript function or server CFC that the control calls to get progress information each time the period defined by the interval attribute elapses. You cannot use this attribute with a duration attribute.
bind.name: bind

oncomplete.help: This function will be called by CF once work is done. This can be used to reset status of progress bar text or enabling the button, which might be in disable mode while task was under progress or something more.
oncomplete.name: oncomplete

duration.help: If callback is not defined then based on this value, ColdFusion will decide percentage work done. One of the callback or totaltime attribute needs to be defined.
duration.name: duration

interval.help: Time interval on which progressbar will keep on updating.
interval.name: interval

style.help: The following are the supported styles:â€¢ bgcolor: The background color for the progress bar. A hexadecimal value without â€œ#â€ prefixed. textcolor: Text color on progress bar. progresscolor: Color used to indicate the progress
style.name: style

autoDisplay.help: Set to true to display the progress bar.
autoDisplay.name: autoDisplay

onError.help: The JavaScript function to run on an error condition. The error can be a network error or server-side error.

style.name: style

onError.help: The JavaScript function to run on an error condition. The error can be a network error or server-side error.
onError.name: onError

password.help: Set a password for modifying the sheet.
password.name: password

action.help: One of the following: â€¢ read - Reads the contents of an XLS format file. â€¢ update - Adds a new sheet to an existing XLS file. You cannot use the uppdate 		action to change an existing sheet in a file. For more information, see Usage. â€¢ write - Writes a new XLS format file or overwrites an existing file.
action.name: action

rows.help: The range of rows to read. Specify a single number, a hypen-separated row range, a comma-separated list, or any combination of these; for example: 1,3-6,9.
rows.name: rows

overwrite.help: A Boolean value specifying whether to overwrite an existing file.
overwrite.name: overwrite

src.help: The pathname of the file to read.
src.name: src

filename.help: The pathname of the file that is written.
filename.name: filename

columns.help: Column number or range of columns. Specify a single number, a hypen-separated column range, a comma-separated list, or any combination of these; for example: 1,3-6,9.
columns.name: columns

query.help: â€¢ read action: The query in which to store the converted spreadsheet file. You must specify format, name , or query. â€¢ write and update actions: A query variable containing the data to write. You must specify name or query.
query.name: query

headerrow.help: Row number that contains column names.
headerrow.name: headerrow

name.help: read action: The variable in which to store the spreadsheet file data. You must specify name or query.if format='csv' then name will contain csv variable. if format='html' then name will contain html content. write and update actions: A variable containing CSV-format data or an ColdFusion spreadsheet object containing the data to write. You must specify name or query.
name.name: name

format.help: Format of the data represented by the name variable.
format.name: format

excludeheaderrow.help: If set to true, excludes the header row from being included in the query results.
excludeheaderrow.name: excludeheaderrow

autosize.help: If false, all comuns of sheets will not be resized.
autosize.name: autosize

width.help: Width of the media player, in pixels.

height.help: Height of the media player, in pixels.

extensionfilter.help: Use this attribute to specify the type of file that you will allow to be uploaded. For example, to let only image files to be uploaded, you can specify file extensions like .jpg, .jpeg, or .png

stopOnError.help: Specifies whether or not to ignore the exceptions for this operation. When the value is true, it stops uploading, displays an appropriate error

bitOR.help: Performs a bitwise logical OR operation.

bitShrn.help: Performs a bitwise shift-right, no-rotation operation.

encoding.help: A string specifying encoding of the input data.

charsetDecode.help: Converts as string to a binary representation.

binaryobject.help: A variable containing binary data to decode into text.

encoding.help: The character encoding that was used to encode the string into binary format.

charsetEncode.help: Uses the specified encoding to convert binary data to a string.

chr.help: Converts a numeric value to a UCS-2 character.
chr.name: chr

cJustify.help: Centers a string in a field length.
cJustify.name: cJustify

compare.help: Performs a case-sensitive comparison of two strings. -1, if string1 is less than string2 0, if string1 is equal to string2 1, if string1 is greater than string2

compareNoCase.help: Performs a case-insensitive comparison of two strings. An indicator of the difference: A negative number, if string1 is less than string2 0, if string1 is equal to string2 A positive number, if string1 is greater than string2
compareNoCase.name: compareNoCase

cos.help: Calculates the cosine of an angle that is entered in radians. A number; the cosine of the angle.

urltowsdl.help: WSDL file URL; location of web service
urltowsdl.name: urltowsdl

createObject.name: createObject

createTimespan.help: Creates a date/time object that defines a time period. You can add or subtract it from other date/time objects and use it with the cachedWithin attribute of cfquery.
createTimespan.name: createTimespan

createUUID.help: Creates a Universally Unique Identifier (UUID). A UUID is a 35-character string representation of a unique 128-bit integer xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx : x is a hexadecimal digit
createUUID.name: createUUID

dateAdd.help: Adds units of time to a date. [datepart - quicky] yyyy: Year; q: Quarter; m: Month; y: Day of year; d: Day w: Weekday; ww: Week; h: Hour; n: Minute; s: Second; l: Millisecond
dateAdd.name: dateAdd

dateCompare.help: Performs a full date/time comparison of two dates. -1, if date1 is less than date2 0, if date1 is equal to date2 1, if date1 is greater than date2 [datepart - quicky] yyyy: Year; q: Quarter; m: Month; y: Day of year; d: Day w: Weekday; ww: Week; h: Hour; n: Minute; s: Second; l: Millisecond
dateCompare.name: dateCompare

dateConvert.help: Converts local time to Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), or UTC to local time. The function uses the daylight savings settings in the executing computer to compute daylight savings time, if required. [type - quicky] local2Utc: Converts local time to UTC time. utc2Local: Converts UTC time to local time
dateConvert.name: dateConvert

dateDiff.help: Determines the integer number of units by which date1 is less than date2. [datepart - quicky] yyyy: Year; q: Quarter; m: Month; y: Day of year; d: Day w: Weekday; ww: Week; h: Hour; n: Minute; s: Second; l: Millisecond
dateDiff.name: dateDiff

dateFormat.help: Formats a date value using U.S. date formats. For international date support, use LSDateFormat. [mask - quicky] d,dd,ddd,dddd: Day of month / week m,mm,mmm,mmmm: Month; y,yy,yyyy: Year; gg: Period/era string short / medium / long / full
dateFormat.name: dateFormat

datePart.help: Extracts a part from a date value as a numeric. [datepart - quicky] yyyy: Year; q: Quarter; m: Month; y: Day of year; d: Day w: Weekday; ww: Week; h: Hour; n: Minute; s: Second; l: Millisecond
datePart.name: datePart

dayOfWeek.help: Determines the day of the week, in a date.

dayOfYear.help: Determines the day of the year, in a date.

daysInMonth.help: Determines the number of days in a month.

de.help: Postpones evaluation of a string as an expression, when it is passed as a parameter to the IIf or Evaluate functions. Escapes any double quotation marks in the parameter and wraps the result in double quotation marks.

decimalFormat.help: Converts a number to a decimal-formatted string.

decrementValue.help: Decrements the integer part of a number.

key.help: Key or seed used to encrypt the string. * For the CFMX_COMPAT algorithm, any combination of any number of characters; used as a seed used to generate a 32-bit encryption key. * For all other algorithms, a key in the format used by the algorithm. For these algorithms, use the GenerateSecretKey function to generate the key.
key.name: key

algorithm.help: The algorithm to use to decrypt the string. Must be the same as the algorithm used to encrypt the string. * CFMX_COMPAT: the algorithm used in ColdFusion MX and prior releases. This algorithm is the least secure option (default). * AES: the Advanced Encryption Standard specified by the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) FIPS-197. * BLOWFISH: the Blowfish algorithm defined by Bruce Schneier. * DES: the Data Encryption Standard algorithm defined by NIST FIPS-46-3. * DESEDE: the "Triple DES" algorithm defined by NIST FIPS-46-3.
algorithm.name: algorithm

encoding.help: The binary encoding used to represent the data as a string. Must be the same as the algorithm used to encrypt the string. * Base64: the Base64 algorithm, as specified by IETF RFC 2045. * Hex: the characters A-F and 0-9 represent the hexadecimal byte values. * UU: the UNIX standard UUEncode algorithm (default). If you specify this parameter, you must also specify the algorithm parameter.
encoding.name: encoding

ivorsalt.help: Specify this parameter to adjust ColdFusion encryption to match the details of other encryption software. If you specify this parameter, you must also specify the algorithm parameter. * For Block Encryption Algorithms: This is the binary Initialization Vector value to use with the algorithm. The algorithm must contain a Feedback Mode other than ECB. This must be a binary value that is exactly the same size as the algorithm block size. * For Password Based Encryption Algorithms: This is the binary Salt value to transform the password into a key.
ivorsalt.name: ivorsalt

iterations.help: The number of iterations to transform the password into a binary key. Specify this parameter to adjust ColdFusion encryption to match the details of other encryption software. If you specify this parameter, you must also specify the algorithm parameter with a Password Based Encryption (PBE) algorithm. Do not specify this parameter for Block Encryption Algorithms. You must use the same value to encrypt and decrypt the data. * For Password Based Encryption Algorithms: This is the binary Salt value to transform the password into a key.
iterations.name: iterations

findNoCase.help: Finds the first occurrence of a substring in a string, from a specified start position. If substring is not in string, returns zero. The search is case-insensitive.

findOneOf.help: Finds the first occurrence of any one of a set of characters in a string, from a specified start position. The search is case-sensitive.

firstDayOfMonth.help: Determines the ordinal (day number, in the year) of the first day of the month in which a given date falls.

fix.help: Converts a real number to an integer.

formatBaseN.help: String Converts number to a string, in the base specified by radix. For example: #FormatBaseN(1024,16)#

generateSecretKey.help: Gets a secure key value for use in the encrypt function.

getContextRoot.help: Returns path to the J2EE server context root for the current request.

getCurrentTemplatePath.help: Gets the absolute path of the page that calls this function.

getFunctionList.help: Displays a list of the functions that are available in CFML.

gatewayID.help: Identifier of the gateway that provides the GatewayHelper object.

cfid._help: Unique client ID. Part of the session key.

cftoken._help: Unique ID. Part of the session key.

lastvisit._help: Date and time of the last visit.

timecreated._help: Date and time of first visit.

device.cordova._help: Version of Cordova running on device

accelerometer.frequency._help: Frequency to invoke callback with current acceleration (in milliseconds)

events.isplugged._help: A boolean that represents whether or not the device is plugged in or not

auth_password._help: (IIS) The value entered in the client's authentication dialog. This variable is available only if Basic authentication is used.

auth_type._help: If the server supports user authentication, and the script is protected, this is the protocol-specific authentication method used to validate the user.

auth_user._help: (IIS) The name of the user as it is derived from the authorization header sent by the client, before the user name is mapped to a Windows account. This variable is no different from CGI.REMOTE_USER. If you have an authentication filter installed on your Web server that maps incoming users to accounts, use CGI.LOGON_USER to view the mapped user name.

cert_cookie._help: (IIS) Unique ID for the client certificate, returned as a string. This can be used as a signature for the whole client certificate.

cert_flags._help: (IIS) bit0 is set to 1 if the client certificate is present. bit1 is set to 1 if the certification authority of the client certificate is invalid (that is, it is not in the list of recognized certification authorities on the server). If bit 1 of CGI.CERT_FLAGS is set to 1, indicating that the certificate is invalid, IIS version 4.0 and later will reject the certificate. (Note: Earlier versions of IIS will not reject the certificate.)

cert_issuer._help: Issuer field of the client certificate (O=MS, OU=IAS, CN=user name, C=USA).

cert_keysize._help: (IIS) Number of bits in the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) connection key size. Example: 128

cert_secretkeysize._help: (IIS) Number of bits in server certificate private key. Example: 1024

cert_serialnumber._help: (IIS) Serial number field of the client certificate.

cert_server_issuer._help: (IIS) Issuer field of the server certificate.

cert_server_subject._help: (IIS) Subject field of the server certificate.

cert_subject._help: Subject field of the client certificate.

cf_template_path._help: Show the entire file path to the coldfusion template, similar to CGI.PATH_TRANSLATED. Example: c:\inetpub\wwwroot\somesite\somepage.cfm

content_length._help: The length of the content as given by the client.

content_type._help: For queries that have attached information, such as HTTP POST and PUT, this is the content type of the data.

gateway_interface._help: The revision of the CGI specification to which this server complies. Format: CGI/revision.

https._help: (IIS/Zeus) Returns ON if the request came in through a secure channel; or it returns OFF, if the request is for an insecure channel. Example: SSL

https_keysize._help: (IIS/Zeus) Number of bits in the SSL connection key size. Example: 128

https_secretkeysize._help: (IIS/Zeus) Number of bits in the server certificate private key. Example: 1024

https_server_issuer._help: (IIS) Issuer field of the server certificate.

https_server_subject._help: (IIS) Subject field of the server certificate.

http_accept._help: List of Content-types the browser can accept (defined by the HTTP Accept header).

http_accept_encoding._help: (IIS) Returns a list of accepted encoding types. Example: gzip, deflate

http_accept_language._help: (IIS) Returns a string describing the language to use for displaying content.

http_connection._help: (IIS) Returns a string describing the connection type. Example: Keep-Alive

http_cookie._help: (IIS) Returns the cookie string that was included with the request.

http_host._help: (IIS) Returns the name of the Web server. This may or may not be the same as CGI.SERVER_NAME depending on type of name resolution you are using on your Web server (IP address, host header).

http_referer._help: The referring document. The document that linked to or submitted form data.

http_user_agent._help: The browser the client is currently using to send the request. Format: software/version library/version.

path_info._help: The extra path information, as given by the client. In other words, scripts can be accessed by their virtual pathname, followed by extra information at the end of this path. The extra information is sent as CGI.PATH_INFO.

query_string._help: The query information that follows the ? in the URL that referenced this script.

remote_addr._help: The IP address of the remote host making the request.

remote_host._help: The hostname making the request. If the server does not have this information, it sets CGI.REMOTE_ADDR and leaves this unset.

remote_user._help: If the server supports user authentication, and the script is protected, this is the username they have authenticated as. (Also available as CGI.AUTH_USER.)

request_method._help: The method with which the request was made. For HTTP, this "GET", "HEAD", "POST", etc.

script_name._help: A virtual path to the script being executed, used for self-referencing URLs.

server_name._help: The servers hostname, DNS alias, or IP address as it appears in self-referencing URLs.

server_port._help: The port number to which the request was sent.

server_port_secure._help: (IIS) A string that contains either 0 or 1. If the request is being handled on the secure port, then this is 1. Otherwise, it is 0.

server_protocol._help: The name and revision of the information protocol this request came in with. Format: protocol/revision.

server_software._help: The name and version of the information server software answering the request (and running the gateway). Format: name/version.

productversion._help: ColdFusion product release information. Comma seperated list of build numbers, first number is the major build number. Example: 7,0,1,116466

productlevel._help: ColdFusion product level information, for example: "Professional", "Enterprise", or "Developer"

supportedlocales._help: Locales supported by ColdFusion, comma seperated.

appserver._help: Name of J2EE Application server, for stand-alone ColdFusion the value is "JRun4".

rootdir._help: Directory ColdFusion is installed to Example: C:\CFusionMX7

additionalinformation._help: Information about the host operating system.

buildnumber._help: Build number of the host operating system.

applicationname._help: Name of the application set with the cfapplication tag, or in Application.cfc

cfid._help: Unique Session ID. Part of the session key.

cftoken._help: Unique Session ID. Part of the session key.

succeeded._help: Yes or No dependent on value of ErrorCode.

returnvalue._help: The result value depending on the action performed, as follows: getCurrentDir = current directory (string) getCurrentURL = current URL (string) existsDir = yes/no existsFile = yes/no exists = yes/no

filecontent._help: Response body; for example: the contents of a html page retrieved by a GET operation. Empty if you save the response in a file.

mimetype._help: MIME type specified by the response Content-Type header, Example: text/html

header._help: Raw response header containing all header information in a single string. Contains the same information as the #cfhttp.responseHeader# variable.

responseheader._help: The response headers formatted into a structure. Each element key is the header name, such as Content-Type or Status_Code. If there is more than one instance of a header type, the type values are put in an array. One common technique is to dynamically access the cfhttp.responseHeader structure as a dynamic array, example: #cfhttp.resonseHeader[fieldVariable]#

statuscode._help: The HTTP status_code header value followed by the HTTP Explanation header value. Example: 200 OK

date._help: Date sent value from message header.

messagenumber._help: Sequential message number of message on POP server.

currentrow._help: The current row of the query in a loop.

recordcount._help: Total number of records in the query.

attachments._help: Contains a tab-separated list of all original attachment names. (only when action="getall")

attachmentfiles._help: Contains a tab-separated list of the actual temporary filenames written to the server. (only when action="getall")

executiontime._help: Execution time for the request in milliseconds. (only when returnCode="true")

statuscode._help: Status code for the stored procedure. (only when returnCode="true")

diagnostics._help: Detailed error diagnostics. Available for Exception and Request type errors.

mailto._help: E-mail address of the administrator who should be notified. This value is set in the mailTo attribute of the cferror tag. Available for Exception and Request type errors.

datetime._help: Date and time when the error occurred. Available for Exception and Request type errors.

browser._help: Browser that was running when the error occurred. Available for Exception and Request type errors.

generatedcontent._help: Any content that ColdFusion generated in response to the request prior to the error. Available for Exception and Request type errors.

remoteaddress._help: IP address of the remote client. Available for Exception and Request type errors.

httpreferer._help: Page containing the HTML link to the page on which the error occurred. This value is an empty string if the user specified the page directly in the browser. (string). Available for Exception and Request type errors

template._help: Page being executed when the error occurred. Available for Exception and Request type errors.

querystring._help: URL query string of the client's request, if any. Available for Exception and Request type errors.

validationheader._help: Text for the header of the default validation message. Available for Validation type errors.

invalidfields._help: Unordered list of validation errors that occurred. This includes any text that you specify in the value attribute or a hidden tag used to validate form input. Available for Validation type errors.

validationfooter._help: Text for the footer of the default validation message. Available for Validation type errors.

type._help: Exception type, possible values: Application, Database, Template, Security, Object, MissingInclude, Expression, Lock, SearchEngine or a Custom Type.

message._help: Error message associated with the exception. Available for Exception type errors.

tagcontext._help: Array of structures containing information for each tag in the tag stack The tag stack consists of each tag that is currently open. Available for Exception type errors.

attemptedserverfile._help: Specifies whether or not ColdFusion attempted to save a file.

clientdirectory._help: Full path of the uploaded file on the clients system.

clientfile._help: Filename of the uploaded file on the clients system.

clientfileext._help: Extension of the uploaded file on the clients system without a period.

clientfilename._help: Filename without an extension of the uploaded file on the client's system.

contentsubtype._help: MIME content subtype of the saved file.

contenttype._help: MIME content type of the saved file.

datelastaccessed._help: Date and time the uploaded file was last accessed.

fileexisted._help: Specifies whether or not the file already existed with the same path.

filewasappended._help: Specifies whether or not ColdFusion appended a file to an existing file.

filewasoverwritten._help: Specifies whether or not ColdFusion overwrote a file.

filewasrenamed._help: Specifies whether or not the uploaded file was renamed to avoid a name conflict.

filewassaved._help: Specifies whether or not ColdFusion saved a file.

oldfilesize._help: Size of a file that was overwritten in the file upload operation.

serverdirectory._help: Full path of the file actually saved.

serverfile._help: Filename of the file actually saved.

serverfileext._help: Extension of the uploaded file on the server, without a period Example: txt

serverfilename._help: Filename, without an extension, of the uploaded file on the server.

timecreated._help: Time the uploaded file was created.

timelastmodified._help: Date and time of the last modification to the uploaded file.

type._help: The exception's type, possible values: Application, Database, Template, Security, Object, MissingInclude, Expression, Lock, SearchEngine or a Custom Type.

message._help: The exception's default diagnostic message, if one was provided. If no diagnostic message is available, this is empty.

detail._help: A detailed message from the CFML compiler. This message, which can contain HTML formatting, can help to determine which tag threw the exception.

errnumber._help: An internal expression error number. Available for expression exceptions.

nativeerrorcode._help: The native error code associated with this exception. Database drivers typically provide error codes to assist in the diagnosis of failing database operations. The values assumed by CFCATCH.NativeErrorCode are driver-dependent. If no error code is provided, the value of CFCATCH.nativeErrorCode is -1. The value is 0 for queries of queries. Available for database exceptions.

sqlstate._help: The SQLState code associated with this exception. Database drivers typically provide error codes to assist in the diagnosis of failing database operations. SQLState codes are more consistent across database systems than native error codes. If the driver does not provide an SQLState value, the value of CFCATCH.SQLState is -1. Available for database exceptions.

lockname._help: The name of the affected lock. This is set to "anonymous" if the lock name is unknown. Available for locking exceptions.

lockoperation._help: The operation that failed. This is set to "unknown" if the failed operation is unknown. Available for locking exceptions.

missingfilename._help: The name of the missing file. Available for missingInclude exceptions.

errorcode._help: The cfthrow tag can supply a value for this code through the errorCode attribute. For Type="Database", CFCATCH.ErrorCode has the same value as CFCATCH.SQLState. Otherwise, the value of CFCATCH.ErrorCode is the empty string.

extendedinfo._help: Custom error message information. This is returned only to CFCATCH tags for which the type attribute is "Application" or a custom type. Otherwise, the value of CFCATCH.ExtendedInfo is empty.

queryerror._help: The error message as reported by the database driver. Available for database exceptions.

sql._help: The SQL statement sent to the data source. Available for database exceptions.

where._help: If the query uses the cfqueryparam tag, query parameter name-value pairs. Available for database exceptions.

name._help: The application name. If you do not set this variable, or set it to the empty string, your CFC applies to the unnamed application scope, which is the ColdFusion J2EE servlet context.

applicationtimeout._help: Life span, as a real number of days, of the application, including all Application scope variables. Use the CFML CreateTimeSpan function to generate this variableâ€™s value.

clientmanagement._help: Specifies whether the application supports Client scope variables.

clientstorage._help: Specifies where Client variables are stored; can be cookie, registry, or the name of a data source.

loginstorage._help: Whether to store login information in the Cookie scope or the Session scope.

mappings._help: A structure that contains ColdFusion mappings. Each element in the structure consists of a key and a value. The logical path is the key and the absolute path is the value.

sessionmanagement._help: Specifies whether the application supports Session scope variables.

sessiontimeout._help: Life span, as a real number of days, of the user session, including all Session variables.

setclientcookies._help: Specifies whether to send CFID and CFTOKEN cookies to the client browser.

setdomaincookies._help: Specifies whether to set CFID and CFTOKEN cookies for a domain (not just a host).

scriptprotect._help: Specifies whether to protect variables from cross-site scripting attacks.

securejson._help: Specifies whether to add a security prefix in front of the value that a ColdFusion function returns in JSON-format in response to a remote call.

securejsonprefix._help: The security prefix to put in front of the value that a ColdFusion function returns in JSON-format in response to a remote call if the secureJSON setting is true.

welcomefilelist._help: A comma-delimited list of names of files.

ormenabled._help: Specifies whether ORM should be used for the ColdFusion application.

ormsettings._help: The struct that defines all the ORM settings.

autogenmap._help: autogenmap=true|false - Specifies whether ColdFusion should automatically generate mapping for the persistent CFCs. If autogenmap=false, mapping should be provided in the form of .HBMXML files.

cacheconfig._help: Specifies the location of the configuration file that should be used by the secondary cache provider.This setting is used only when secondarycacheenabled=true.

cacheprovider._help: Specifies the cache provider that should be used by ORM as secondary cache. The values can be: 						    * Ehcache 						    * JBossCache 						    * Hashtable 						    * SwarmCache 						    * OSCache  Fully qualified name of the class for any other cache provider.  This setting is used only when secondarycacheenabled=true

catalog._help: Specifies the default Catalog that should be used by ORM.

cfclocation._help: Specifies the directory (or array of directories) that should be used by ColdFusion to search for persistent CFCs to generate the mapping. If cfclocation is set, ColdFusion looks at only the paths specified in it. If it is not set, ColdFusion looks at the application directory, its sub-directories, and its mapped directories to search for persistent CFCs.

datasource._help: Specifies the data source that should be used by ORM. If it is not specified here, then the data source specified for the application is picked up.

dbcreate._help: ColdFusion ORM can automatically create the tables for your application in the database when ORM is initialized for the application. This can be enabled by using dbcreate in ormsettings. dbCreate takes the following values: 						    * update: Setting this value creates the table if it does not exist or update the table if it exists. * dropcreate: Setting this value drops the table if it exists and then creates it. * none (default): Setting this value does not change anything in the database schema.

eventhandling._help: eventHandling=true|false - Specifies whether ORM Event callbacks should be given.

flushatrequestend._help: flushatrequestend=true|false - Specifies whether ormflush should be called automatically at request end. If flushatrequestend is false, ormflush is not called automatically at request end.

logsql._help: logSQL=true|false - Specifies whether the SQL queries that are executed by ORM will be logged. If LogSQL=true, the SQL queries are logged to the console.

savemapping._help: savemapping=false|true -  Specifies whether the generated Hibernate mapping file has to be saved to disc. If you set the value to true, the Hibernate mapping XML file is saved with the filename "CFC name".hbmxml in the same directory as the CFC.

schema._help: Specifies the default Schema that should be used by ORM.

secondarycacheenabled._help: secondarycacheenabled=true|false - Specifies whether secondary caching should be enabled.

sqlscript._help: Path to the SQL script file that gets executed after ORM is initialized. This applies if dbcreate is set to dropcreate. This must be the absolute file path or the path relative to the application.The SQL script file lets you populate the tables before the application is accessed.

usedbformapping._help: useDBForMapping=true|false - Specifies whether the database has to be inspected to identify the missing information required to generate the Hibernate mapping. The database is inspected to get the column data type, primary key and foreign key information.

skipcfcwitherror._help: skipCFCWithError=true|false - Lets you specify if ColdFusion must skip the CFCs that have errors. If set to true, ColdFusion ignores the CFCs that have errors.

automanagesession._help: autoManageSession=true|false - Lets you specify if ColdFusion must manage Hibernate session automatically.

datasource._help: Name of the data source from which the query retrieves data.

enablerobustexception._help: Overrides the default administrator settings. It does not report compile-time exceptions.

debuggingipaddress._help: A list of ip addresses that need debugging.

smtpserversettings._help: A struct that contains the following values: server, username, and password.If no value is specified, takes the value in the administrator.

s3._help: A struct to define Amazon S3 storage.

sessioncookie.httponly._help: Determines if session cookies to be set as HttpOnly or not. i.e. accessible only to Http requests

sessioncookie.secure._help: Determines if session cookies to be set as secure or not. i.e. returned on any type of connection or only secured ( https) connections

sessioncookie.domain._help: Domain for which the cookie should be set. This should match exactly with the domain, with which application would be accessed

sessioncookie.disableupdate._help: Disables update of session cookie using cfcookie or cfheader tag

inmemoryfilesystem.enabled._help: Enable Virtual File System for this application

inmemoryfilesystem.size._help: Sets the size of Virtual File System

ormsettings.searchenabled._help: If true, ORM search is enabled

ormsettings.search.indexdir._help: If specified, creates a folder by entity name in the file system where indexes for all entities are saved. If not specified, creates the folder in the application root directory

ormsettings.search.language._help: The language that is used to index and search. Default is English

cache._help: Struct that defines all cache settings.

cache.configfile._help: Path to ehcache.xml file for application specific cache configuration.

javasettings._help: Specify paths from where custom Java classes to be loaded

javasettings.loadpaths._help: Array of paths from where custom Java classes to be loaded

javasettings.loadcoldfusionclasspath._help: Boolean. Indicates whether ColdFusion's class loader should be the parent of this application specific class loader that will be created

javasettings.reloadonchange._help: Boolean. If true, jars/classes will be picked up dynamically without a restart of the server

javasettings.watchinterval._help: Specifies the amount of time in seconds after which the files under the directory or jar files will be monitored for change

javasettings.watchextensions._help: Specifies a list of extensions that will be monitored for change when reloadonchange is set to true

serversideformvalidation._help: If no, disables validation on cfform fields when the form is submitted

restsettings.cflocation._help: The location where the scanning of CFC would be done to find all the REST enabled CFCs in an application

restsettings.skipcfcwitherror._help: Defines an action to be taken if an error occur when scanning the CFCs. If the true, it skips the error and goes on to scan the next CFC, else the startup of that application fails

restsettings.autoregister._help: Defines if the REST application should be registered and initialized

document.usewebkit._help: If webkit implementation should be used for CFDocument tag

security.antisamypolicy._help: File path for antisamy policy file

authcookie.disableupdate._help: Disables update of cfauthorization cookie using cfcookie or cfheader tag

chartstyledirectory._help: Application specific client side charting styles directory. Specify a directory path relative to Application.cfc or an absolute path

cache.querysize._help: Maximum number of queries to be stored in default query cache region

wssettings.version.publish._help: Specifies which version of the Axis should be used for publishing the WebService. If the wsversion is specified as "1" then Axis 1 is used. If it is "2" then Axis 2 is used

wssettings.version.consume._help: Specifies which version of the Axis should be used for consuming the WebService. If the wsversion is specified as "1" then Axis 1 is used. If it is "2" then Axis 2 is used

wssettings.style._help: Specifies which style for WSDL to be used for publishing the WebService

wssettings.includecftypesinwsdl._help: If set to true, will include the schemas for the ColdFusion types such as Struct, QueryBean and Document in the WSDL

sameformfieldsasarray._help: If set to true, values of multiple form fields with same name in Form scope are represented as array, else list.

onabort._help: Path to the template handler when request is aborted, beause of cfabort, cflocation, or cfcontent

onwsauthenticate._help: Function to authenticate a WebSocket client when it invokes a corresponding client side JS API 'authenticate'.

wschannels._help: Array of struct containing websocket name and handler

serializequeryas._help: The format for query to be serialized

preservecaseforserialize._help: Boolean. Whether to preserve case of struct keys or not. Default value: true
